commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when the
requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has a stable/wallaby branch, tests
will continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I911cea72aafb12def52244d011cfe3c027e4a42e

commit_message:
Propose to retire monasca-analytics from deliverables

This project was retired in Oct 2020. Independent deliverable file (never
used) should probably be removed.

The goal of this patch is to initiate the discussion with the monasca team
to see if we can proceed or not.

Change-Id: Ie8ffee3d71c902773540d031d24c88af2189075d

[{'created': '2021-06-28 22:36:06.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Another grub headache

While investigating another grub issue, I was confused by the path
taken in the logs reported, and noticed that on a ramdisk, we might
not actually have a valid response to os.path.ismount, I'm guessing
depending on what in memory filesystem is in use while also coupled

adds additional logging to make it easier to figure out what is.

Change-Id: Ibd3060bef2e56468ada6b1a5c1cc1632a42803c3
"}, {'created': '2021-06-29 21:15:00.000000000', 'message': "Catch ismount not being handled

While investigating another grub issue, I was confused by the path
taken in the logs reported, and noticed that on a ramdisk, we might
not actually have a valid response to os.path.ismount, I'm guessing
depending on what in memory filesystem is in use while also coupled

Adds a test to validate that exceptions raised on these commands

Change-Id: Ibd3060bef2e56468ada6b1a5c1cc1632a42803c3
"}]
commit_message:
Catch ismount not being handled

While investigating another grub issue, I was confused by the path
taken in the logs reported, and noticed that on a ramdisk, we might
not actually have a valid response to os.path.ismount, I'm guessing
depending on what in memory filesystem is in use while also coupled
with attempting to check a filesystem.

Adds a test to validate that exceptions raised on these commands
where this issue can be encountered, are properly bypassed, and also
adds additional logging to make it easier to figure out what is
going on in the entire bootloader setup sequence.

Change-Id: Ibd3060bef2e56468ada6b1a5c1cc1632a42803c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-04 02:24:50.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib392d89aded3c0f639036bb47739d10f5396a346
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib392d89aded3c0f639036bb47739d10f5396a346

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-09 13:43:31.000000000', 'message': 'Xena-2 Release for python-ironic-inspector-client

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for python-ironic-inspector-client.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates

Xena-2 Release for openstacksdk

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for openstacksdk.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates
are made available.

If you are happy with the current release hash, please +1 this patch
and we will process a release. If you need to get some important
changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with a new
commit hash to use once it is ready.

leave a comment explaining that and we can abandon the patch.

commit_message:
Create queens-eol tag for manila-ui project

Following the lead of the Horizon team, the Manila team
is not longer accepting patches to stable/queens branch
in the Manila UI project. This patch proposes to create
a queens-eol tag for manila-ui project.

Horizon's announcement email: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/023381.html

Change-Id: Idd26744e3d1d33bbffb0676bef6c0c0e89fed1d5

commit_message:
Fix ImportError No module named queue in python2.7 env.

The queue module name in py2.7 is Queue
The queue module nane in py3.x is queue.

This patch can fix the compatible issue.

Change-Id: I1e2891bb027083a7da6804eb3c8a8cb1ca7af57a

commit_message:
support restore from volume backup in cloud layer

In addition to the existing methods to create/get/list/search/delete
volume backups, this adds restoring a volume backup to the cloud layer.

Change-Id: Ie1d10b16b832c43ca73e1a10fdb43ed009afe144

commit_message:
Mark openstacksdk-functional-devstack-base as abstract

Zuul introduced an 'abstract' flag that can be used to mark jobs that
are not intended to be used directly but only as base jobs.
openstacksdk-functional-devstack-base is such a job, so mark it that
way.

Change-Id: Ib17d51e570950a794a2a90aaedbaccf0b5a92608

commit_message:
Base devstack sanity check on os_service_types

We have a list of services we can use. Rather than just listing a few,
list them all. The test only does anything if there is an env var set
anyway.

Change-Id: Id75b829361a7184d50d4587bd36d3d21c80d0359

We don't have normalization for networks yet, so this gets us there.
There's a bunch of tests that need to be updated bcaues they assume a
complete passthrough dict.

commit_message:
Fix argparse connection example

The example code was having someone pass a CloudRegion to
openstack.connect, which is incorrect, since openstack.connect makes a
CloudRegion on behalf of the user.

Update the example to not be broken.

Change-Id: Iec60f3c06bbe92b1cfc3b2bb305eb9f774007c88

With Glance v1, the image fields in the create call need to be in
headers prefixed with either 'x-image-meta-' or

commit_message:
Send image fields in headers for PUT in Glance v1

With Glance v1, the image fields in the create call need to be in
headers prefixed with either 'x-image-meta-' or
'x-image-meta-property-'.

For the image upload, the header 'content-type' must be set to
'application/octet-stream'.

Story: #2003885
Task: #26747

Change-Id: If549937714339ff934c0a02b52c95158dc89ad59

commit_message:
Normalize container resources

Normalizing is important to protect ourselves from potential backward
incompatible changes that may remove or rename existing attributes.

In order to define what fields are in a normalized container, the
current return of the create and retrieve functions were considered;
new fields considered relevant were added as well, as follows:

- bytes
- count
- last_modified
- location (new)
- name
- properties (new)

Story: #2003745
Task: #26427

Change-Id: I15d94bca647352030f167981f24c1d9a016ad88b

commit_message:
Normalize network resources

Normalizing is important to protect ourselves from potential backward
incompatible changes that may remove or rename existing attributes.

In order to define what fields are in a normalized network, the current
params of the create and update functions were considered; new fields
considered relevant were added as well, as follows:

- availability_zone_hints
- availability_zones (new)
- admin_state_up
- created_at (new)
- external
- id (new)
- location (new)
- mtu_size -> mtu (renamed)
- name
- port_security_enabled
- project_id
- properties (new)
- shared
- status (new)
- subnets (new)
- tenant_id (new)
- updated_at (new)

tenant_id is relevant because create_subnet takes it vs project_id,
which is confusing. Let's keep both in order to sweep under the carpet.

Story: #2003743
Task: #26425

Change-Id: I361dbacb4a29d54248242486c9a75c15b982869f

Looks pretty good! Seems to work in my manual testing against devstack. However, we're changing the API here with a new method and new parameters to existing methods, so we should have a release note with this change.

Also, we seem to be lacking functional tests for these methods (in openstack/tests/functional/cloud/test_object.py). I think we should add some to verify that these changes do what we expect. commit_message:
Allow returning munch on create and get container

The attribute metadata is added to the get_container and create_container
signatures, defaulting to true. When set to false, the return will change from
a metadata dict object to a Munch object with the container description.

Story: #2003559
Task: #24850

Change-Id: Ib2a226f14dbc8e3f6587d1b088df6a7fa6044b5d

(1 comment)

Minor thing- otherwise looks great. Probably wants a release note?'}, {'account_id': 10338, 'date': '2018-05-14 20:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-14 20:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 00:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Not something I've ever played with in Glance, but appears to make sense:
"Additionally, you may include additional properties specified as key:value pairs, where the value must be a string data type."

The issue appears to be on the unpacking:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/720965/

We're setting the value correctly, glance is getting it, but when I get the image back via the SDK it isn't there.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-08-27 00:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10338, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10338, 'date': '2018-11-09 23:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10338, 'date': '2018-11-15 15:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-12-05 09:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I'm really wondering here. It of course make sense, but it does not work in my cloud either.

1) According to image API doc such "properties" can be sent simply as additional attributes, and not as a `properties` structure (this works for me)
2) According to image API doc all the custom properties would be also returned standalone, but you do not look in the result for unknown props. As Adrian mentioned they might be present in the json, but would not land in the main object'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-07-16 13:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Too old to know what to do. Please reopen/rebase if required.'}]

commit_message:
Added image properties to Image class

explicit: os_admin_user, hw_quemu_guest_agent, os_require_quiesce
Also exposes custom (unexpected) K/V properties on the Image object.

Change-Id: Ibb92fbeba93bca29882f4f551bb7f41a4e6f5a62

commit_message:
Add capability to compute.limits object to poll other projects

At present, it is not possible for an admin user to query the limits of
all projects using this SDK.

This patch enables a client with valid admin credentials to pass the
project_id parameter to compute.limits.get to query projects other than
their own.

Example use of this: an admin generating a list of all the quotas and
usages of all projects in the cloud.

Change-Id: I0043697da8abde9950e04f14802e9f752459e7b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-13 04:51:04.000000000', 'message': 'Normalize object resources

Normalizing is important to protect ourselves from potential backward
incompatible changes that may remove or rename existing attributes.

In order to define what fields are in a normalized object, the
current return of the create and retrieve functions were considered;
new fields considered relevant were added as well, as follows:

- bytes
- content_type
- hash
- last_modified
- location (new)
- name
- properties (new)

Change-Id: I6e0adad9493a1e7e0914ac9cf0a42963d3e20254

Normalizing is important to protect ourselves from potential backward
incompatible changes that may remove or rename existing attributes.

In order to define what fields are in a normalized object, the
current return of the create and retrieve functions were considered;
new fields considered relevant were added as well, as follows:

- bytes
- content_type
- hash
- last_modified
- location (new)
- name
- properties (new)

Change-Id: I6e0adad9493a1e7e0914ac9cf0a42963d3e20254
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize object resources

Normalizing is important to protect ourselves from potential backward
incompatible changes that may remove or rename existing attributes.

In order to define what fields are in a normalized object, the
current return of the create and retrieve functions were considered;
new fields considered relevant were added as well, as follows:

- bytes
- content_type
- hash
- last_modified
- location (new)
- name
- properties (new)

Change-Id: I6e0adad9493a1e7e0914ac9cf0a42963d3e20254

commit_message:
Allow returning munch on create and get object

The attribute return_metadata is added to the get_container and
create_container signatures, defaulting to true. When set to false,
get_container will return (munch, body) instead of (metadata, body),
while create_container will return munch instead of metadata.

Story: #2003572
Task: #24866

Change-Id: I0fb10569b236b8f0f231fbe673aa0724de0669c7

actually glance is not strict at all - you are free to set any additional property with any value. We need a more general approach on handling what is send/retrieved from Glance."}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-07-16 13:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

"}, {'created': '2018-08-16 19:40:13.000000000', 'message': "Glance v2 allows people to overwrite metadata key

Seems like glance isn't all that strict on setting metadata
and on sending it back out; so to help coerce the metadata that

commit_message:
Glance v2 allows people to overwrite metadata key

Seems like glance isn't all that strict on setting metadata
and on sending it back out; so to help coerce the metadata that
glance sends back into a type we can use we need to json load
it if it is a string type (vs a dict), especially when a user
has written that key themselves.

Change-Id: Ie52488089c55ab2eaad7530de6365486eddbedb5

commit_message:
Modify the 'auth_type' value to correct

The default of 'auth_type' is 'password', if we use OS_TOKEN and
don't set OS_AUTH_TYPE=token, it would return a cryptic message
because it does not expect a token to be use.
The patch modify the 'auth_type' value if we use --os-token,
OS_TOKEN or auth.token.

Change-Id: I9b81b7af89c1240515f025b4bcbceb358bcdb9b5
Task: 33691
Story: 2005877

commit_message:
Add an error message when router add subnet

When router add subnet that it's cide overlaps with existing
associated subnet, the openstack CLI didn't print any error.
The patch exposes the error message about subnet conflict.

Change-Id: I25f1bf85564fbc0d9aa4ac82180a789683902d6a
Task: 13849
Story: 1747525

commit_message:
Fix 'block_store' aliases define error

This patch fix volume aliases error, the service type use
'block-storage', but aliases define use 'block_storage'.
So, Can't use 'block_store' finish list volumes.

commit_message:
Strip the version prefix from the next link for pagination

keystoneauth1 appends the version prefix to the url causing the
pagination url to be incorrect when using the url prefix from
next link. Thus we are stripping the version prefix from the
next link for pagination to work correctly

Change-Id: Iad8e69d20783cfe59c3e86bd6980da7dee802869
Closes-Bug: 1748534
(cherry picked from commit 76b941dbb3f2ab700af9573f1d31b974f5fa851d)

subject: Fix --limit param in cluster objects
messages:
[{'account_id': 25395, 'date': '2018-06-19 06:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25395, 'date': '2018-06-19 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25395, 'date': '2018-06-20 01:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25395, 'date': '2018-06-20 03:09:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22299, 'date': '2018-06-20 07:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-06-20 07:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-06-20 12:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Sorry, this is not a bug, it's how pagination works in the SDK. The "limit" parameter does not mean "limit the total number of results" it means "limit the page size" returned. List calls return an iterator - which is only called when needed. SO - if someone wants to get only one result:

  next(conn.clustering.profiles())

and if someone REALLY wants to optimize and have the server only return records one at a time and then retrieve only one:

  next(conn.clustering.profiles(limit=1))

I don't think we should set pagination=False because that is removing support for pagination. In fact, I think we should remove pagination as a parameter - because the pagination support in sdk now knows how to autodetect additional pages.

Perhaps we just need some better docs on how pagination works now?'}, {'account_id': 25395, 'date': '2018-06-22 06:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> Sorry, this is not a bug, it's how pagination works in the SDK. The
 > "limit" parameter does not mean "limit the total number of results"
 > it means "limit the page size" returned. List calls return an
 > iterator - which is only called when needed. SO - if someone wants
 > to get only one result:
 > 
 > next(conn.clustering.profiles())
 > 
 > and if someone REALLY wants to optimize and have the server only
 > return records one at a time and then retrieve only one:
 > 
 > next(conn.clustering.profiles(limit=1))
 > 
 > I don't think we should set pagination=False because that is
 > removing support for pagination. In fact, I think we should remove
 > pagination as a parameter - because the pagination support in sdk
 > now knows how to autodetect additional pages.
 > 
 > Perhaps we just need some better docs on how pagination works now?

Thank you Monty Taylor, I may miss understand what I mean. Yes, I do know pagination is to show the next page. I just change the default value of `pagination`, because if I only set `limit=1` and set the `pagination` parameter as default (True), the _list() function in openstack/resource.py will return all records. (Pls refer to: https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/resource.py#L932)
Only I set `limit=1` and `pagination=False`, I can get one record. 

So I think to change the fault value to False.'}, {'account_id': 25395, 'date': '2018-06-22 06:57:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Sorry, this is not a bug, it's how pagination works in the SDK. The
 > "limit" parameter does not mean "limit the total number of results"
 > it means "limit the page size" returned. List calls return an
 > iterator - which is only called when needed. SO - if someone wants
 > to get only one result:
 > 
 > next(conn.clustering.profiles())
 > 
 > and if someone REALLY wants to optimize and have the server only
 > return records one at a time and then retrieve only one:
 > 
 > next(conn.clustering.profiles(limit=1))
 > 
 > I don't think we should set pagination=False because that is
 > removing support for pagination. In fact, I think we should remove
 > pagination as a parameter - because the pagination support in sdk
 > now knows how to autodetect additional pages.
 > 
 > Perhaps we just need some better docs on how pagination works now?

Thank you Monty Taylor, You may miss understand what I mean. Yes, I do know pagination is to show the next page. I just change the default value of `pagination=False`, because if I only set `limit=1` and set the `pagination` parameter as default (True), the _list() function in openstack/resource.py will return all records. (Pls refer to: https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/resource.py#L932)
Only I set `limit=1` and `pagination=False`, I can get one record. 

So I think to change the fault value to False.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-07-16 13:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Too old to know what to do. Please reopen/rebase if required.'}]

commit_message:
Fix --limit param in cluster objects

When we excute list command of cluster objects with param
--limit 1, senlinclient return all records. But actually, we only
need the first record.

Change-Id: Icdb9b4017547729e2fa1dfebc8f8f00ce8103331
Closes-Bug: #1752014

subject: Fix api request miss microversions
messages:
[{'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The Adapter constructor has a parameter "default_microversion". We should set that instead of adding an additional header. keystoneauth has some code in it to send old-style headers for the services that are not compliant.

Also - I think we should only set default_microversion if there is a "." in the api_version. That is - if the user has set "compute_api_version=2" - I don't think we should set default_microversion=2 - because that's not actually a microversion, it's just a normal version request.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:50:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Agree to Monty's suggestion, we are supposed to leverage whatever keystoneauth1 has exposed (from Adapter or Connection or ...). With that, I believe SDK code is mostly dealing with different service versions today. I'd suggest we name all variables related to microversion in a way that other developers can easily understand it is not about API version.

API version is mostly about endpoints, while micro-version is about a special HTTP header to be sent. Please try separate these logics as clear as possible.

Ideally, we will have automatic, transparent API version negotiation and micro-version negotiation someday."}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-23 06:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-03-23 09:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-07-16 13:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Too old to know what to do. Please reopen/rebase if required.'}]

"}]
commit_message:
Fix api request miss microversions

This patch fix api request, add default_microversion parameter
configure microversions, the default_microversion value is 'None',
if the service set api version, the default_microversion value
is api_version, if the api request miss microversions,
the server can't finish microversion controller.

Change-Id: Id8a1df57ba0b04fdba9817e62c9149bc72f2cb09
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 14:52:33.000000000', 'message': "Remove support for arbitrary attributes from CloudRegion

Early in os-client-config's life we added a magical __getattr__
that would let you access settings from the config dict as arbitrary
object access. That worked fine-ish for a short while before we started
growing a real API on that object.

However, now it's pretty awful, because if someone tries to call a
method that doesn't exist, they get an error about NoneType not having
an attribute - because the magical getattr is returning None for their
object lookup and then python tries to call that.

Before we get too many people migrated from os-client-config to
openstack.config, remove the magic.

Change-Id: I63463824b7a9a2b47c92d6b9aa4c0f47f5b88766
"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 18:33:55.000000000', 'message': "Remove support for arbitrary attributes from CloudRegion

that would let you access settings from the config dict as arbitrary

growing a real API on that object.

However, now it's pretty awful, because if someone tries to call a
method that doesn't exist, they get an error about NoneType not having
an attribute - because the magical getattr is returning None for their
object lookup and then python tries to call that.

Before we get too many people migrated from os-client-config to
openstack.config, remove the magic.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540481
Change-Id: I63463824b7a9a2b47c92d6b9aa4c0f47f5b88766

commit_message:
Remove support for arbitrary attributes from CloudRegion

Early in os-client-config's life we added a magical __getattr__
that would let you access settings from the config dict as arbitrary
object access. That worked fine-ish for a short while before we started
growing a real API on that object.

However, now it's pretty awful, because if someone tries to call a
method that doesn't exist, they get an error about NoneType not having
an attribute - because the magical getattr is returning None for their
object lookup and then python tries to call that.

Before we get too many people migrated from os-client-config to
openstack.config, remove the magic.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540481
Change-Id: I63463824b7a9a2b47c92d6b9aa4c0f47f5b88766

commit_message:
Remove deprecated wait_for methods from Proxy

The wait_for methods on the Proxy base class are deprecated for removal.
With the proxy2/proxy switch done, it seems like a good time to go ahead
and remove them.

Change-Id: I414e68a305856e9ed1d8f13270d37e0398bdc350

[{'created': '2021-07-09 20:02:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add installation of mypy stubs packages

The cinder-mypy job is failing because library stubs aren't installed
for requests [0].  Modify the mypywrap.sh to accept options specified
in an environment variable named OS_MYPY_OPTS to the mypy invocation,
and set this var in tox.ini.

The value is "--install-types --non-interactive" which is suitable for
CI purposes, and seems to make sense for local tox use as well [1].
The downside is it basically runs mypy twice, once to determine
whether there are any library stubs missing and then install them, and
againto do the actual check.  If we don't want this setting in
tox.ini, we can move it to .zuul.yaml for the cinder-mypy job run.

[0] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b66ee6c21e594940941585b0e9e5082a
[1] https://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/running_mypy.html#library-stubs-not-installed

Change-Id: Id69cb519ee7300b33ff087de4e7d46cdad67d162
'}, {'created': '2021-07-12 14:06:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add installation of mypy stubs packages

commit_message:
Add installation of mypy stubs packages

The cinder-mypy job is failing because library stubs aren't installed
for requests [0].  Modify the mypywrap.sh to accept options specified
in an environment variable named OS_MYPY_OPTS to the mypy invocation,
and set this var in tox.ini.

The value is "--install-types --non-interactive" which is suitable for
CI purposes, and seems to make sense for local tox use as well [1].
The downside is it basically runs mypy twice, once to determine
whether there are any library stubs missing and then install them, and
againto do the actual check.  If we don't want this setting in
tox.ini, we can move it to .zuul.yaml for the cinder-mypy job run.

Also, update the version of mypy in test-requirements to a version
that supports the above options.

And, run mypy in its own env (instead of reusing pep8) so that the
tox logs are preserved during CI runs.

[0] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/b66ee6c21e594940941585b0e9e5082a
[1] https://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/running_mypy.html#library-stubs-not-installed

Change-Id: Id69cb519ee7300b33ff087de4e7d46cdad67d162

Enable bandit

This commit enables bandit check and update the version to larger than
1.6.0 to prevent some issue.

Change-Id: I8da25bbb00ea2a6793b62924eb59c468b7384668

messages:
[{'account_id': 30077, 'date': '2021-01-02 05:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-01-20 11:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

This needs a lot more information'}, {'account_id': 30077, 'date': '2021-03-04 02:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-04-14 12:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30077, 'date': '2021-04-15 02:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-04-15 18:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

we need enough detail in the spec that someone else could implemnet
it fi they needed too.

so i would like to see an example fo creating an exsitng server with a tag as well as
example api request fo what the partial tag request would look like.

e.g. tag="my-vms[1-0]+" which would select vms with my-vms1 my-vms2 but not my-vmsA or my-vms since A is not in the charter class [1-0] and my-vms does not match as at least 1 number is required by the +

this is the type of examples an infomation i would like to see in this spec to explain how it would be used by an enduser. 

we shoudl also detail how the db change will be done.

you sugessted using like but i belive then the match form would be db speicifc so i think we should use regex_match instead and define and instead use the python regex format to be dbms indepented.

i have noted that inline too but just wanted to reinforce the point that the behavior of api partmer shoudl not change if we use sqlite vs mysql vs postgres.'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2021-07-06 09:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-07-06 13:45:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This still isn't anywhere near detailed enough, as the comments from other reviewers indicate"}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-07-16 13:00:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Procedural -2: We hit spec freeze. If you are still working on this the please re-propose it to Yoga.'}]

commit_message:
Cache AgentClient on Task, not globally

In order to avoid potential cache coherency issues
when using a globally cached AgentClient, e.g. with
TSL certificates from the IPA, cache the AgentClient
on a per task basis.

Co-Authored-By: Arne Wiebalck <arne.wiebalck@cern.ch>

Conflicts:
	ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/agent_base.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/ansible/deploy.py
	ironic/drivers/modules/iscsi_deploy.py
	ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent.py

Story: #2009004
Task: #42678

Change-Id: I0c458c8d9ae673181beb6d85c2ee68235ccef239
(cherry picked from commit fcb6a1096f48336f19a5e8aa80445f57d4480c08)

Victoria.

commit_message:
Remove convert_data function

This patch removes the convert_data function which has been introduced
with the first one and deprecated Command Line Interface. The
--validation and --group arguments were sending comma-separated strings
instead of list. The new Command Line Interface is now enforcing this by
using its own CommaList Parser Action and only accepting List of groups
or validation names.

This function is now useless and can be removed safely. Tests and usages
have been modified accordingly.

Change-Id: Ief9459e914ea73fbd59a85c07a55c26078e0126a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-01 12:28:55.000000000', 'message': 'Don't reverse rules order before applying

When the rules are sorted by name and then reversed, the "999 drop all"
rule gets applied first. On slow connections where ansible may need to
reconnect over SSH while the firewall rules are being applied, the
connection could be denied if the allow rule for SSH is not yet added.
The deployment will then hang and fail.

Additionally, if the task fails before all firewall rules are added, the
user wouldn't be able to connect over SSH if that rule is not yet added.

By not using "reverse", the "999 drop all" rule will be added last.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If0fae5dfbde6271a32eb9750f06044f402b11215
'}, {'created': '2021-07-01 15:51:27.000000000', 'message': 'Don't reverse rules order before applying

When the rules are sorted by name, reversed, and then inserted, the "999
drop all" rule gets applied first. On slow connections where ansible may
need to reconnect over SSH while the firewall rules are being applied,
the connection could be denied if the allow rule for SSH is not yet
added.  The deployment will then hang and fail.

Additionally, if the task fails before all firewall rules are added, the
user wouldn't be able to connect over SSH if that rule is not yet added.

By not using "reverse", and appending the rules instead of inserting,
the "999 drop all" rule will be added last.

commit_message:
Don't reverse rules order before applying

When the rules are sorted by name, reversed, and then inserted, the "999
drop all" rule gets applied first. On slow connections where ansible may
need to reconnect over SSH while the firewall rules are being applied,
the connection could be denied if the allow rule for SSH is not yet
added.  The deployment will then hang and fail.

Additionally, if the task fails before all firewall rules are added, the
user wouldn't be able to connect over SSH if that rule is not yet added.

By not using "reverse", and appending the rules instead of inserting,
the "999 drop all" rule will be added last.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If0fae5dfbde6271a32eb9750f06044f402b11215

A couple of things here:

* The last patch on horizon's stable/queens was merged in March, that is not that old. Since there are not so much activity on this branch (in Extended Maintenance) it does not need so much attention to keep it open (at least as long as gate is working) so in my understanding it could be kept open as long as gate is fine, without any pain. Does the team really want to close this branch?
* Have you checked whether there are zuul job definitions outside openstack/horizon repository that can be deleted as soon as stable/queens is deleted? (2nd step in EOL process [1])
* Is there any other repository that is handled by Horizon team and its stable/queens can be EOL'd together with Horizon's stable/queens?

I'll give -1 for now to get some attention to my comments. (Of course if everything is good to go, then I'll change it to +2)

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#end-of-life"}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2021-07-12 07:21:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since there are not so much activity on this branch (in Extended Maintenance) it does not need so much attention to keep it open (at least as long as gate is working) so in my understanding it could be kept open as long as gate is fine, without any pain. Does the team really want to close this branch?
>> yeah horizon team discussed this topic and agreed to move stable/queens to EOL.

> * Have you checked whether there are zuul job definitions outside openstack/horizon repository that can be deleted as soon as stable/queens is deleted? (2nd step in EOL process [1])
>> I have gone through the horizon stable/queens``.zuul.yaml`` [2] and didn't find any zuul job definitions that can be removed once stable/queens is deleted.
[2] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/stable/queens/.zuul.yaml

> * Is there any other repository that is handled by Horizon team and its stable/queens can be EOL'd together with Horizon's stable/queens?
> 
>> As you may already know horizon have many horizon plugins and I looked at each horizon plugins ``.zuul.yaml`` and found one plugin i.e. openstack/manila-ui [3] depends-on horizon django-job templates. So we can't move further until manila-ui stable/queens(currently em) is moved to EOL. 

[3] https://github.com/openstack/manila-ui/blob/stable/queens/.zuul.yaml#L9-L10

> I'll give -1 for now to get some attention to my comments. (Of course if everything is good to go, then I'll change it to +2)
>

Or simply that jobs are removed from manila-ui (or the job definition is moved there from horizon).
Thanks Vishal for checking these!

Create queens-eol tag for horizon project

Horizon Team is no longer accepting patches to stable/queens
branch, this patch proposes to create queens-eol tags for
horizon project.

Announcement email: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/023381.html

Change-Id: I503828b13ae9203c48e4ea948af969aaf2671b1e

use payloads for PORT AFTER_DELETE events

This patch switches over to callback payloads for PORT
AFTER_DELETE events.
Some shims were removed.

commit_message:
Fix TypeError when formatting BGP IP address.

floating_ip_address may be a netaddr.IPAddress, and using '+'
to append the /32 suffix raises a TypeError. Explicitly convert to
string before appending the suffix.

Additionally, introduce a unit test case for floatingip_update_callback
to test that the error does not re-appear.

Closes-Bug: #1924237
Signed-off-by: Aggelos Kolaitis <akolaitis@admin.grnet.gr>
Change-Id: I98d266fb986649f1d14969c968baa2f93b469f73
(cherry picked from commit 43f50d5d9b5c8859354014d1c21ed94ad19560d6)

commit_message:
Add share resource to shared file system

Introduce Shares class with basic methods
including list, create, delete, get and update to
shared file system storage service.

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/ashrod98-openstacksdk-manila-support/us/11?kanban-status=2360120

Change-Id: Ia7d7c88eb55307296336e2f04a00e92bdca6f8ae

The (likely) root cause fix for this problem is located here:

https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22bug%252F1853009%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

but it's several patches and still under review. Since this patch reduces the window for the race significantly enough to make a difference for operators, I support backporting it.

Clean backport, LGTM"}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-07-14 19:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck

tests returned a "post failure" unrelated to changeset'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-07-14 22:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/799772/1/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 29m 18s'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-07-14 23:08:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck

failures were related to volume issues, different than last failures. Nearly impossible for an ironic driver change to cause it.

Details: {'code': 400, 'message': 'Invalid volume: Volume status must be available or error or error_restoring or error_extending or error_managing and must not be migrating, attached, belong to a group, have snapshots or be disassociated from snapshots after volume transfer.'}, <traceback object at 0x7f30fdcf2d00>), (<class 'tempest.lib.exceptions.TimeoutException'>, Request timed out
Details: (LiveMigrationTest:tearDownClass) Failed to delete volume 47b08241-a465-4bdc-afb0-d80c4f72f8af within the required time (196 s). Timer started at 1626297450. Timer ended at 1626297646waited for 196, <traceback object at 0x7f30fdd37840>))"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-07-15 01:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck

I'm not sure we've seen the same job fail twice :|"}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-07-15 21:30:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck 

starting to see a pattern of

`Details: {'code': 400, 'message': 'Invalid volume: Volume status must be available or error or error_restoring or error_extending or error_managing and must not be migrating, attached, belong to a group, have snapshots or be disassociated from snapshots after volume transfer.'}, <traceback object at 0x7f425fa8e2c0>), (<class 'tempest.lib.exceptions.TimeoutException'>, Request timed out`

in the failures.

Clearly unrelated to this patch, but it seems there may be a problem in this area?"}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2021-07-15 21:46:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

According to sean-k-mooney in IRC, this is a bug around when volumes detach. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/794757 is working through the logic to make it less likely to fail. It's not expected to be completed for a couple of weeks.

Until that lands, we'll just have to recheck here until we win the gate-lottery."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-07-16 00:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-07 14:28:39.000000000', 'message': '[ironic] Minimize window for a resource provider to be lost

This patch is based upon a downstream patch which came up in discussion
amongst the ironic community when some operators began discussing a case
where resource providers had disappeared from a running deployment with
several thousand baremetal nodes.

Discussion amongst operators and developers ensued and we were able
to determine that this was still an issue in the current upstream code
and that time difference between collecting data and then reconciling
the records was a source of the issue. Per Arun, they have been running
this change downstream and had not seen any reoccurances of the issue
since the patch was applied.

This patch was originally authored by Arun S A G, and below is his
original commit mesage.

An instance could be launched and scheduled to a compute node between
get_uuids_by_host() call and _get_node_list() call. If that happens
the ironic node.instance_uuid may not be None but the instance_uuid
will be missing from the instance list returned by get_uuids_by_host()
method. This is possible because _get_node_list() takes several minutes to return
in large baremetal clusters and a lot can happen in that time.

This causes the compute node to be orphaned and associated resource
provider to be deleted from placement. Once the resource provider is
deleted it is never created again until the service restarts. Since
resource provider is deleted subsequent boots/rebuilds to the same
host will fail.

This behaviour is visibile in VMbooter nodes because it constantly
launches and deletes instances there by increasing the likelihood
of this race condition happening in large ironic clusters.

To reduce the chance of this race condition we call _get_node_list()
first followed by get_uuids_by_host() method.

Change-Id: I55bde8dd33154e17bbdb3c4b0e7a83a20e8487e8
Co-Authored-By: Arun S A G <saga@yahoo-inc.com>
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit f84d5917c6fb045f03645d9f80eafbc6e5f94bdd)
'}]
commit_message:
[ironic] Minimize window for a resource provider to be lost

This patch is based upon a downstream patch which came up in discussion
amongst the ironic community when some operators began discussing a case
where resource providers had disappeared from a running deployment with
several thousand baremetal nodes.

Discussion amongst operators and developers ensued and we were able
to determine that this was still an issue in the current upstream code
and that time difference between collecting data and then reconciling
the records was a source of the issue. Per Arun, they have been running
this change downstream and had not seen any reoccurances of the issue
since the patch was applied.

This patch was originally authored by Arun S A G, and below is his
original commit mesage.

An instance could be launched and scheduled to a compute node between
get_uuids_by_host() call and _get_node_list() call. If that happens
the ironic node.instance_uuid may not be None but the instance_uuid
will be missing from the instance list returned by get_uuids_by_host()
method. This is possible because _get_node_list() takes several minutes to return
in large baremetal clusters and a lot can happen in that time.

This causes the compute node to be orphaned and associated resource
provider to be deleted from placement. Once the resource provider is
deleted it is never created again until the service restarts. Since
resource provider is deleted subsequent boots/rebuilds to the same
host will fail.

This behaviour is visibile in VMbooter nodes because it constantly
launches and deletes instances there by increasing the likelihood
of this race condition happening in large ironic clusters.

To reduce the chance of this race condition we call _get_node_list()
first followed by get_uuids_by_host() method.

Change-Id: I55bde8dd33154e17bbdb3c4b0e7a83a20e8487e8
Co-Authored-By: Arun S A G <saga@yahoo-inc.com>
Related-Bug: #1841481
(cherry picked from commit f84d5917c6fb045f03645d9f80eafbc6e5f94bdd)

[{'created': '2021-07-06 02:36:08.000000000', 'message': "Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

Change-Id: If7b3640191d84e5cf30cbbcb1cc94aa0f068d11c
(cherry picked from commit 2225f9666b157de773fc1dadf195034e24e2577b)
(cherry picked from commit d5b8ced547f5bf163b7ef76ef82a687af61434f9)
"}]
commit_message:
Support cinder image conversion on an NFS share

New CinderImageConversionNfsShare and CinderImageConversionNfsOptions
parameters add support for mounting an external NFS share for cinder
to use when converting glance images to or from another format (e.g.
qcow2 versus raw).

This feature is useful in preventing the node's root disk from filling
up in situations where the available disk space is too small, which
can happen in deployments that utilize very large glance images.

Change-Id: If7b3640191d84e5cf30cbbcb1cc94aa0f068d11c
(cherry picked from commit 2225f9666b157de773fc1dadf195034e24e2577b)
(cherry picked from commit d5b8ced547f5bf163b7ef76ef82a687af61434f9)

commit_message:
Removing import conditional for 'collections.abc'

The conditional is no longer useful, as the relevant subpackage
is part of 'collections' since python 3.3 and recent tripleo
releases (since Ussuri) use python > 3.6.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I353d04d0322d06e8072edda09978cefde3c36168

commit_message:
Sort jobs in molecule.yaml file when adding new role

This patch adds a mechanism to keep the job names in
zuul.d/molecule.yaml sorted. Therefore, the to_nice_yaml filter is not
indenting lists correctly, due to [1][2].

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/48865
[2] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/234

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia8f787631c55fabb3a097919971d17b93711d4b7
(cherry picked from commit ae59abe62c65aaa7286090e2d1b98508d6c7ff6f)
(cherry picked from commit cc29577f73da1c6227461731f04d37c244b29a0e)

subject: Add zuul.d/molecule.yaml file back in the yamllint ignore list
messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-07-06 10:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-06 15:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27427, 'date': '2021-07-15 21:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-06 10:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add zuul.d/molecule.yaml file back in the yamllint ignore list

The validation_init role auto generates the molecule.yaml file when
adding a new role. But, due to [1][2], the to_nice_yaml filter is not
correctly indenting lists and will break the indentation every time a
new validation will be created.

This patch adds this file to the yamllint ignore list and provides a new
molecule.yaml sorted by job names as the validation_init role will
generate in a follow up patch.

Moreover, this patch enables the oslo_config_validator molecule job in
the check/gate as it was not added in the initial patch[3].

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/48865
[2] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/234
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/789698

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iac63dc6f161a0e885110a246b68001522a6f62e3
(cherry picked from commit 41dcda85921b4a79a46eaccbe28f0fffd516e3cf)
(cherry picked from commit f798c56ba56c1fbda7f7c517044155d80e913ec2)
'}]
commit_message:
Add zuul.d/molecule.yaml file back in the yamllint ignore list

The validation_init role auto generates the molecule.yaml file when
adding a new role. But, due to [1][2], the to_nice_yaml filter is not
correctly indenting lists and will break the indentation every time a
new validation will be created.

This patch adds this file to the yamllint ignore list and provides a new
molecule.yaml sorted by job names as the validation_init role will
generate in a follow up patch.

Moreover, this patch enables the oslo_config_validator molecule job in
the check/gate as it was not added in the initial patch[3].

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/48865
[2] https://github.com/yaml/pyyaml/issues/234
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-validations/+/789698

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iac63dc6f161a0e885110a246b68001522a6f62e3
(cherry picked from commit 41dcda85921b4a79a46eaccbe28f0fffd516e3cf)
(cherry picked from commit f798c56ba56c1fbda7f7c517044155d80e913ec2)

[{'created': '2021-07-08 15:14:28.000000000', 'message': 'Neutron: Use the pids subsystem to look up container id

Currently we rely on cgroup name to detect id of sidecar containers but
the name is not managed by podman and it is not guaranteed that it is
consistent with container id.
This changes switches the base record to the pid subsystem which is
actively managed by podman and more likely to be consistent with
container ids.

(cherry picked from commit b1e992a739057d0b3b72dedeb9e6c47a14f47829)
(cherry picked from commit 8c2862d2307b5be069db4ec4c8d90bc3b31ffbb6)

commit_message:
Neutron: Use the pids subsystem to look up container id

Currently we rely on cgroup name to detect id of sidecar containers but
the name is not managed by podman and it is not guaranteed that it is
consistent with container id.
This changes switches the base record to the pid subsystem which is
actively managed by podman and more likely to be consistent with
container ids.

Closes-Bug: #1933918
Change-Id: Id57f86e62409e257f5619dc8b360cee3f922c805
(cherry picked from commit b1e992a739057d0b3b72dedeb9e6c47a14f47829)
(cherry picked from commit 8c2862d2307b5be069db4ec4c8d90bc3b31ffbb6)

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

commit_message:
nova-common: add memcached config keys for keystonemiddleware

Modern versions of OpenStack (confirmed under Rocky and Victoria)
have two separate keys for specifying memcached servers to use - one
for Nova itself (which the cookbook already handled) and one for the
Keystone middleware (which it did not). As a result, with only the former
set Nova keeps on complaining in the logs (at least under Rocky) about
still using in-process token cache.

Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <marek.szuba@cern.ch>
Change-Id: I7930048a55a26e66c1dd041245ae5b23794eada1

jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest

(1 comment)

Also is this changing the default behaviour of a deployment?'}, {'account_id': 26032, 'date': '2020-07-14 00:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26032, 'date': '2020-07-14 00:58:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Also is this changing the default behaviour of a deployment?

That's a good question. As of Stein there are initial values as well as regular values, the latter being absolute whilst the initial values are able to be overridden. Setting the regular values preserves the default behaviour of a deployment in the truest way, but we should probably consider only setting 'initial' values by default and regular values to 'None' to enable operator discretion/ utility."}, {'account_id': 10058, 'date': '2020-08-20 12:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

LGTM, just need to fix the merge conflict'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2020-08-21 19:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

LGTM, but needs a rebase. A Full CI run is not strictly needed because smoke is bionic-train'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2020-10-06 20:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Hi Brett. Quick question: why is this only being added to train template, if the config option was added in Stein?'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2020-10-17 23:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hey Brett, I noticed that the nova-cloud-controller charm already has those config options and they don't work for stein release or newer (I haven't tested if they work on rocky, but I'd assume so, since they are there).

Having the same setting in both charms in redundant and confusing to the user. So I think they should live in one place. Considering they are already there, I suggest passing them through the relation data.

The VERY big disadvantage of that, is that even if the customer wants to have a different cpu_allocation_ratio and would define a "nova-compute2" app for that, it wouldn't work if they are read through the relation data. The customer would need a "nova-cloud-controller2" to do that, and I am not sure of the implications of that (would need 3 of those for HA? makes no sense)

So alternatively, in this case, you could have the setting in both, but update the config docs in nova-cloud-controller charm stating that the config there only works for releases prior to stein, and to refer to the config in nova-compute charm for stein+.'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2020-10-19 00:34:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

An ideal behavior would be to use the config value passed through the relation data from nova-cloud-controller, but to override it with nova-compute's own config if non-empty value is set. So that we can keep the backward compatibility while allowing users to set an individual ratio per a compute group (multiple application spawned by the nova-compute charm). My 2 cents."}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2020-10-19 13:45:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

+1 on Nobuto's suggestion. We need to make sure to document it appropriately so users are aware it is being overridden"}, {'account_id': 26032, 'date': '2021-03-03 00:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 26032, 'date': '2021-03-03 00:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 26032, 'date': '2021-03-03 00:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2021-03-22 16:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 10366, 'date': '2021-03-31 03:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

'}, {'created': '2020-07-14 00:51:49.000000000', 'message': "Added allocation-ratio config opts

From Liberty onwards nova supports setting allocation ratios in the
hypervisor config (nova-compute level).
Prior to this allocation ratios were set at the nova-scheduler level.
The current default values for the equivlient config opts in the
nova-cloud-controller charm are:

cpu-allocation-ratio: 16
ram-allocation-ratio: 0.98
disk-allocation-ratio: 1.0

These values are replicated in the default values of the charm's config options.

Newton introduced the Placement API, and Ocata the ability to have compute
resources (Core/RAM/Disk) precomputed before passing candidates to the
FilterScheduler
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters.html)

Pike removed CoreFilter, RAMFilter and DiskFilter scheduler filters.
From this point forward valid methods for settings these allocation ratios are:
- via a call to the placement API:
(https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventories)
- via config values to nova-compute (xxx_allocation_ratio)

Stein introduced initial_xxx_allocation_ratio in response to the runtime
behaviour of the ResourceTracker.
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html)
As such the precedence of resource ratio values are:
initial_xxx_allocation_ratio < placement API call < xxx_allocation_ratio

That is if xxx_allocation_ratio is set it will be the only value considered,
otherwise the value will fall back to initial_xxx_allocation_ratio which may
be overridden.

Change-Id: Ifa314e9e23e0ae5d16113cd91a7507e61f9de704
Closes-Bug: #1677223
"}, {'created': '2021-03-03 00:01:10.000000000', 'message': "Added allocation-ratio config opts

From Liberty onwards nova supports setting allocation ratios in the
hypervisor config (nova-compute level).
Prior to this allocation ratios were set at the nova-scheduler level.
The current default values for the equivlient config opts in the
nova-cloud-controller charm are:

ram-allocation-ratio: 0.98
disk-allocation-ratio: 1.0

These values are replicated in the default values of the charm's config options.

Newton introduced the Placement API, and Ocata the ability to have compute
resources (Core/RAM/Disk) precomputed before passing candidates to the
FilterScheduler
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters.html)

Pike removed CoreFilter, RAMFilter and DiskFilter scheduler filters.
From this point forward valid methods for settings these allocation ratios are:
- via a call to the placement API:
(https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventories)
- via config values to nova-compute (xxx_allocation_ratio)

Stein introduced initial_xxx_allocation_ratio in response to the runtime
behaviour of the ResourceTracker.
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html)
As such the precedence of resource ratio values are:
initial_xxx_allocation_ratio < placement API call < xxx_allocation_ratio

That is if xxx_allocation_ratio is set it will be the only value considered,
otherwise the value will fall back to initial_xxx_allocation_ratio which may
be overridden.

Change-Id: Ifa314e9e23e0ae5d16113cd91a7507e61f9de704
Closes-Bug: #1677223
"}, {'created': '2021-03-03 00:38:36.000000000', 'message': "Added allocation-ratio config opts

hypervisor config (nova-compute level).
Prior to this allocation ratios were set at the nova-scheduler level.
The current default values for the equivlient config opts in the
nova-cloud-controller charm are:

cpu-allocation-ratio: 16
ram-allocation-ratio: 0.98
disk-allocation-ratio: 1.0

These values are replicated in the default values of the charm's config options.

Newton introduced the Placement API, and Ocata the ability to have compute
resources (Core/RAM/Disk) precomputed before passing candidates to the
FilterScheduler
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters.html)

Pike removed CoreFilter, RAMFilter and DiskFilter scheduler filters.
From this point forward valid methods for settings these allocation ratios are:
- via a call to the placement API:
(https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventories)
- via config values to nova-compute (xxx_allocation_ratio)

Stein introduced initial_xxx_allocation_ratio in response to the runtime
behaviour of the ResourceTracker.
(https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html)
As such the precedence of resource ratio values are:
initial_xxx_allocation_ratio < placement API call < xxx_allocation_ratio

That is if xxx_allocation_ratio is set it will be the only value considered,
otherwise the value will fall back to initial_xxx_allocation_ratio which may
be overridden.

Change-Id: Ifa314e9e23e0ae5d16113cd91a7507e61f9de704
Closes-Bug: #1677223

have compute resources (Core/RAM/Disk) precomputed before passing

- A call to the Placement API [1].
- Config values to supplied to nova-compute (xxx_allocation_ratio).

behaviour of the ResourceTracker [2].

That is a (compute) resource provider's allocation ratios will default
to initial_xxx_allocation_ratio which may be overridden at run time by a
call to the Placement API. If xxx_allocation_ratio is set it will
override all configurations for that provider.

When not otherwise configured, we set initial_xxx_allocation_ratio to
the values provided by ncc to maintain backwards compatibility. Where
initial_xxx_allocation_ratio is not available we set
xxx_allocation_ratio.

commit_message:
Added allocation-ratio config opts

Nova supports setting allocation ratios at the nova-compute level from
Liberty onwards. Prior to this allocation ratios were set at the
nova-scheduler level.

Newton introduced the Placement API, and Ocata introduced the ability to
have compute resources (Core/RAM/Disk) precomputed before passing
candidates to the FilterScheduler [0]. Pike removed CoreFilter,
RAMFilter and DiskFilter scheduler filters.

From Pike onwards valid methods for settings these allocation ratios are via:
- A call to the Placement API [1].
- Config values to supplied to nova-compute (xxx_allocation_ratio).

Stein introduced initial_xxx_allocation_ratio in response to the runtime
behaviour of the ResourceTracker [2].

Currently, the precedence of resource ratio values are:
xxx_allocation_ratio > Placement API call > initial_xxx_allocation_ratio

That is a (compute) resource provider's allocation ratios will default
to initial_xxx_allocation_ratio which may be overridden at run time by a
call to the Placement API. If xxx_allocation_ratio is set it will
override all configurations for that provider.

When not otherwise configured, we set initial_xxx_allocation_ratio to
the values provided by ncc to maintain backwards compatibility. Where
initial_xxx_allocation_ratio is not available we set
xxx_allocation_ratio.

[0] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ocata/implemented/resource-providers-scheduler-db-filters.html
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/placement/#update-resource-provider-inventories
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/stein/implemented/initial-allocation-ratios.html

Change-Id: Ifa314e9e23e0ae5d16113cd91a7507e61f9de704
Closes-Bug: #1677223

messages: [{'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-07-15 21:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-07-15 23:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAbandoning this in favor of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-nova-compute/+/717888'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-15 21:52:12.000000000', 'message': 'Configure CPU|RAM|Dask allocation per compute

Starting with the Ocata release, the aggregate-based overcommit
ratios are no longer honored by the placement service for scheduling
purposes. Instead, the allocation ratios should be set per compute
node, which will update placement information used for scheduling.

One option is to propagate the allocation-ratio settings from the
nova-cloud-controller application to the related nova-compute services.
Another option, which provides a bit more flexibility, is to specify it
at the nova-compute level. Adding options to the nova-compute
application falls more in-line with upstream recommendations to set this
at the compute service and will be more clear to users.

As such, this change adds the {cpu,ram,disk}-allocation config options
to the local nova-compute charm. A subsequent change will deprecate the
configuration settings on the nova-cloud-controller application.

Closes-Bug: #1822268
Change-Id: I99cf632866b2b853755c74f0ee73263f9c3f6c38
'}]
commit_message:
Configure CPU|RAM|Dask allocation per compute

Starting with the Ocata release, the aggregate-based overcommit
ratios are no longer honored by the placement service for scheduling
purposes. Instead, the allocation ratios should be set per compute
node, which will update placement information used for scheduling.

One option is to propagate the allocation-ratio settings from the
nova-cloud-controller application to the related nova-compute services.
Another option, which provides a bit more flexibility, is to specify it
at the nova-compute level. Adding options to the nova-compute
application falls more in-line with upstream recommendations to set this
at the compute service and will be more clear to users.

As such, this change adds the {cpu,ram,disk}-allocation config options
to the local nova-compute charm. A subsequent change will deprecate the
configuration settings on the nova-cloud-controller application.

Closes-Bug: #1822268
Change-Id: I99cf632866b2b853755c74f0ee73263f9c3f6c38

commit_message:
Fix add ping6 security-rule protocol should icmpv6 directly

From original design,icmp can using ipv4 and ipv6 depend on
ethertype value.but neuitron support icmpv6 protocol now,so when
we create ping6 security-rule,we should using icmpv6 protocol

Change-Id: Icb8d090c3f26c2dec09337191d63b00c51943619
Closes-Bug: #1533025

commit_message:
Identity V3 auth response validation

Tempest wasn't validating that the identity response matched what
is expected according to the API spec.

The schema here is based on what's in keystone's unit tests:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/fe830ffe61912bd6e3d06c1b1eb82ca23f9314eb/keystone/tests/unit/test_v3.py#L201

exceptions:
- password_expires_at is not required in tempest because it tests
  older versions of keystone and this is new for O.
- pre-Mitaka versions of keystone erroneously included 'extras' in
  the token response. It's always an empty dict.

Change-Id: I6b70fb88f6292a88e94124ea35bd3738261583e0

commit_message:
Adds tempest test for nova volume update

Adds coverage for the nova volume update (aka swap volume)
functionality. This behavior requires admin priveledges to
run.

Change-Id: I66028490958296dde4abc43dc6afab7a4c2f7837

commit_message:
Add a test for checking a cascade (enable-disable) operation for a project

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
method ’Enable or disable subtree’ (PATCH /projects/{project_id}/cascade):
enables or disables the project itself and its whole subtree.

Partially Implements: blueprint project-subtree-tests

Change-Id: I09fa2419775d3f883996cd74e9b67b0167f4fbd0

[{'account_id': 17107, 'date': '2018-03-30 16:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-30 16:02:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 17107, 'date': '2018-03-30 16:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-03-30 18:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
fix v6 tests on NetworkManager-based operating systems

IPv6 tests are failing on Network Manager-based Operating Systems.
eth1 interface used in dualnet v6 tests is brought down by NM due to
lack of cloud-init and local ifcfg-* config and no dhcp server avaiable
on network eth1 is attached to. This change adds creating a NM
connection for eth1 with mac-based IPv6 link-local address.

Change-Id: Icd8443590da89eefde5f3e9c3d1632bf12fe90f4

honestly, at this level of complexity, lets not use the decorator'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2016-01-12 20:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Using this as a jumping off point, but if not this is there another means that compound conditionals for skips should be handled? I agree that these conditionals can be difficult to understand, but there is currently no other means to handle this. Would a class that define complex conditionals for features make sense?'}, {'account_id': 14819, 'date': '2016-01-13 20:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sean, could you clarify please, how this change should be done without decorator?'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2016-12-30 06:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't understand why we will test "non-block live-migration for instances with attached volumes"? test_iscsi_volume should fail if block_migration is False.
Besides, if the condition is too complex to use the decorator, you can use something like "raise self.skipException".'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-30 07:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

[{'created': '2015-12-31 09:14:37.000000000', 'message': "Refactored skip flags for live-migration with volumes

Current implementation doesn't allow to check non-block

commit_message:
Refactored skip flags for live-migration with volumes

Current implementation doesn't allow to check non-block
live-migration for instances with attached volumes. This
patches allows to configure flags, so it's become possible.

Change-Id: I3b6a9afc4b07835031f10375718c02de4d95b877

subject: Fix detach_volume

Fix detach_volume

Removed try-expect and use call_and_ignore_notfound_exc function

Change-Id: I8e2ccbb94e12e945899f904052d922ea3fed8a95

- Run existing tests for volume v3, plus v3 specific tests - several patches. This would add about 150 tests to the gate; I would prefer to see tests introduced at a slower rate, to avoid gate instability.

commit_message:
Add support for cinder api v3 api testing

cinder api version 3 is the latest current version.

Implemented cinder v3 clients.
Added cinder v3 tests for non-admin
Added cinder v3 tests for admin

Not implemented: VolumesMetadataTest

Change-Id: I8da13f8a12a6b7162454793c24a0455ec2128c11

commit_message:
Add cleanup flag and client param to base classes

The cleanup flag allows for tests to explicitly disable
auto-cleanup in case these want to explicitly cleanup themselves.

The client parameters allows to overrule client, e.g. in case of
admin tests.

Focus in this patchset is to networking base and scenario manager.

Change-Id: I39a34e769480f4490740632a63f6b11346875382

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-08 08:38:10.000000000', 'message': 'Correcting confusing name used in account_generator.py

There is confusion to generate accounts.yaml file.
In help file it is displaying  in positional arguments as below.

positional arguments:
  accounts_file.yaml    Output accounts yaml file

In CLI usage too, displayed as  accounts_file.yaml:
usage: tempest account-generator [-h] [-c /etc/tempest.conf]
               [--os-username <auth-user-name>]
               [--os-password <auth-password>]
               [--os-project-name <auth-project-name>]
               [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>]
               [--os-domain-name <auth-domain-name>]
               [--tag TAG] [-r CONCURRENCY] [--with-admin]
               [-i {2,3}]
               accounts_file.yaml

But in Usage description, it is accounts.yaml:
Create accounts.yaml file for concurrent test runs. One primary user, one alt
user, one swift admin, one stack owner and one admin (optionally) will be
created for each concurrent thread.

So this patch set will correct the confusing name
and use accounts.yaml at every place. Also, it will modify the doc string
by adding that the file can be created with any name. But it is always
appropriate to create with name accounts.yaml

Change-Id: I6b8d95e7d35a5d490cc67afb1855c7e1f7bf4667

commit_message:
Correcting confusing name used in account_generator.py

There is confusion to generate accounts.yaml file.
In help file it is displaying  in positional arguments as below.

positional arguments:
  accounts_file.yaml    Output accounts yaml file

In CLI usage too, displayed as  accounts_file.yaml:
usage: tempest account-generator [-h] [-c /etc/tempest.conf]
               [--os-username <auth-user-name>]
               [--os-password <auth-password>]
               [--os-project-name <auth-project-name>]
               [--os-tenant-name <auth-tenant-name>]
               [--os-domain-name <auth-domain-name>]
               [--tag TAG] [-r CONCURRENCY] [--with-admin]
               [-i {2,3}]
               accounts_file.yaml

But in Usage description, it is accounts.yaml:
Create accounts.yaml file for concurrent test runs. One primary user,
one alt user, one swift admin, one stack owner and one admin
(optionally) will be created for each concurrent thread.

So this patch set will correct the confusing name and use accounts.yaml
at every place. Also, it will modify the doc string by adding that the
file can be created with any name. But it is always appropriate to
create with name accounts.yaml

Change-Id: I6b8d95e7d35a5d490cc67afb1855c7e1f7bf4667

commit_message:
Removing deprecated warning in account_generatory.py

There is a deprecated warning in account_generatory.py
There is no need of keeping this warning now.

Ic8dcaff920e5cdfb9a9457ff3a3137c225622409 suggested this change.
So this patch set will remove the deprecated Log warning.

Change-Id: I1f3e2fb27b43b88c4987ff4d94ebbdb72ac35018

commit_message:
Use system creds for system operations

Keystone's is_admin_project and in future 'system' credentials are used
to perform operations that do not fall into the traditional project
hierarchy. These are operations such as hypervisor or infrastructure
commands that are independant of projects.

Currently to perform those operations you have to use the 'admin
project' and in future this will be renamed to a system scope.

Change-Id: Ic96ee6005606f4998d829ef651219bafdbaa95fe

add test: list snapshots with param offset

'offset' is the number of items to skip from the marker or
from the first element, default 0

commit_message:
Make volume type name luks unique

The name luks is used twice which would make these fail when run in
parallel.

Change-Id: I5107cb99055b19fa13e906087806f5cfd3b04ef5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-16 23:38:47.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Add delay before attaching volumes in scenario tests

DO NOT MERGE

The PowerVM driver needs the tempest vms to have an active RMC
connection to be able to attach volumes. This patch introduces a time
delay before attempting to attach the volume to the instance.

Change-Id: I2fa18f94627b5f94fa675f67551b61226a10faac
'}, {'created': '2018-05-22 19:22:11.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: PowerVM vSCSI CI enablement

DO NOT MERGE

The PowerVM driver needs the tempest vms to have an active RMC
connection to be able to attach volumes. This patch introduces time
delays before attempting to attach the volumes to instances.

Change-Id: I2fa18f94627b5f94fa675f67551b61226a10faac
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: PowerVM vSCSI CI enablement

DO NOT MERGE

The PowerVM driver needs the tempest vms to have an active RMC
connection to be able to attach volumes. This patch introduces time
delays before attempting to attach the volumes to instances.

Change-Id: I2fa18f94627b5f94fa675f67551b61226a10faac

messages:
[{'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I think it would be better to define a devstack-minimal job in the devstack repo and base the new tempest job on that one. That would make it easier to notice changes in the normal "devstack" job, like additions of new services.'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:51:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I think it would be better to define a devstack-minimal job in the
 > devstack repo and base the new tempest job on that one. That would
 > make it easier to notice changes in the normal "devstack" job, like
 > additions of new services.

That'd imply having to copy all the vars from the devstack-tempest job again. That's why I didn't go for that way as I'd like to reuse the code.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Having a devstack-minimal job as parent would allow that be used in a non-tempest context, too.

See also https://review.openstack.org/520115'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add devstack base job with minimal services

This commit adds a new devstack base job with minimal services enabled
so it can be used as a base for jobs where the project would like to
explicitly enable every service.

It would act in a similar way as the base: false was used before.

Change-Id: I899accb02843a4151191e4edd8c6cd5105347acd

[{'created': '2016-02-23 19:49:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add Resources Configuration class

Adding class that loads resources.yaml file or uses existing

Add Resources Configuration class

Adding class that loads resources.yaml file or uses existing
configuration options to build a compatible data structure.

Partially implements blueprint tempest-resources

Change-Id: I1bf5093297b2219636791a15fba07f1ed09362a6
