[{'created': '2017-08-25 23:47:17.000000000', 'message': 'Use neutron client for floating ips in scenarios

os-floating-ips in compute API are deprecated starting with
microversion 2.36.  Several scenarios still use os-floating-ips
implementation in the compute client to create and delete floating ips.

With this change neutron client is used to create and delete floating
ips if neutron service is available.  Otherwise use os-floating-ips
implementation in compute client.

Changes include:
- Moving methods related to creating floating ips using neutron from
  NetworkScenarioTest to its parent ScenarioTest.
- Changed existing method for creating floating ips in ScenarioTest to
  be a wrapper method that uses neutron to create floating ips if

- Add wrapper method for deleting floating ips in ScenarioTest.
- Add admin credential to scenarios that create floating ips.  This is
  necessary because creating floating ips with neutron needs admin
  credential to list ports and find the correct port to associate the
  floating ip to.

commit_message:
Use neutron client for floating ips in scenarios

os-floating-ips in compute API are deprecated starting with
microversion 2.36.  Several scenarios still use os-floating-ips
implementation in the compute client to create and delete floating ips.

With this change neutron client is used to create and delete floating
ips.

Changes include:
- Moving methods related to creating floating ips using neutron from
  NetworkScenarioTest to its parent ScenarioTest.
- Added wait to verify that floating ip has been attached to a server
  when creating floating ip with either network or compute client.
- Removed methods for creating floating ips using compute floating ip
  client.
- Add wrapper method for deleting floating ips in ScenarioTest.
- Add admin credential to scenarios that create floating ips.  This is
  necessary because creating floating ips with neutron needs admin
  credential to list ports and find the correct port to associate the
  floating ip to.

Change-Id: I995ec1568e1bc5b5ee4963721e2b09c21605df63

[{'account_id': 18796, 'date': '2016-01-11 16:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2016-01-11 16:20:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 18796, 'date': '2016-01-11 16:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-01-11 19:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add a test for Get Service Catalog

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
the call 'GET /auth/catalog'

Co-Authored-By: ZhangHongtao<zhanghongtao0826@126.com>
Partially Implements: blueprint authentication-specific-routes-tests
Change-Id: I93a37524b16a190892da850f2f2da0b50c3b42bc

[{'account_id': 15009, 'date': '2015-02-05 18:08:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2015-02-05 18:08:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-02-05 19:04:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Does this file need to be there always (success/failure) ? I mean should we keep it only in case of failure whereas in case of success should we delete it ?'}, {'account_id': 15009, 'date': '2015-02-05 20:32:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think it would be ideal to keep the file around if all tests pass. I don't think it is safe to assume that a user would not want the output file if all tests pass.

For example, if you want to keep a running history of tempest runs, it may be desired to keep those results.

I've also never executed tempest with no failures, is there no output if there are no failures? :)"}, {'account_id': 15009, 'date': '2015-02-11 16:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

xenserver: recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-12-18 18:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-07-08 17:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add options to run_tempest.sh to redirect output to a file

This way the results can be easily stored and retrieved.
 -o | --output will redirect to tempest.out
 -O | --output-file will changed the output file location.

.gitignore was also updated to ignire *.out files since the default output-file is tempest.out

Change-Id: I7caa068fad7ad8897aa0ef3cebd4dd8ae3e8ea72

(1 comment)

I fee this tests is not right. It adds self.non_admin_client.user_id  role on domain which affect the token scope of self.non_admin_client.user_id. Auth has Keystone tokens as scope by default and changing directly self.non_admin_client.user_id makes this user to change the token scope. 

This is passing as non of other tests in this class use self.non_admin_client. Let me put a dependent patch on that for failure (It failing on my local env with some modification.).'}, {'account_id': 7872, 'date': '2016-02-08 12:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2016-09-09 09:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Removed the following votes:

commit_message:
Add a test for 'Get available domain scopes'

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
the method 'GET /auth/domains'

Partially Implements: blueprint authentication-specific-routes-tests

Change-Id: I1f1d09877e50bae44de63d5b6dfb9eed5166e85e

subject: Identity V3 API: this patch adds the test needed for test coverage of method 'Default configuration settings' (GET /domains/config/default)

commit_message:
Identity V3 API: this patch adds the test needed for test
coverage of method 'Default configuration settings'
(GET /domains/config/default)

Change-Id: I1d95b51e52f1c1ad283cf518edd63c8aa22aa0bd

subject: Add a test for 'Delete subtree' Identity API V3 method

commit_message:
Add a test for 'Delete subtree' Identity API V3 method

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
method 'Delete subtree' (DELETE /projects/{project_id}/cascade)

Partially Implements: blueprint project-subtree-tests

Change-Id: Ic0c6697277207b30a44010584e9a96050f4b6599

subject: Add a test for 'Get available project scopes'

commit_message:
Add a test for 'Get available project scopes'

This patch adds the test needed to test OpenStack Identity API v3,
the method 'GET /auth/projects'

Partially Implements: blueprint authentication-specific-routes-tests

Change-Id: I6ad640d70520ca0704eba9964ae93751ca37caba

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-02-23 16:41:05.000000000', 'message': "Adding named regex option group for runner

The option group will be consumed by 'tempest run' command,
e.g. 'tempest run --test-set volume'

Change-Id: I41ad9743f20c143cbc46cc3b27c0240893ec033e
"}]
commit_message:
Adding named regex option group for runner

The option group will be consumed by 'tempest run' command,
e.g. 'tempest run --test-set volume'

subject: Adds the ResourceProvider class
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 97, 'name': 'Daryl Walleck', 'email': 'daryl.walleck@rackspace.com', 'username': 'dwalleck'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 1980, 'name': 'jose-idar', 'email': 'jose.idar@gmail.com', 'username': 'jose-idar'}, {'_account_id': 8001, 'name': 'John Warren', 'email': 'jswarren@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jswarren'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9364, 'name': 'Stephen Lowrie', 'email': 'stephen.lowrie@rackspace.com', 'username': 'step6829'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 97, 'date': '2016-03-01 01:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2016-03-01 01:35:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8001, 'date': '2016-03-02 14:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I do not understand this implementation.  The plan was for the resource provider to provide all resources of a particular type, filtering on resource metadata.  The resource tracker was going to filter based on resources that have already been used.  Where was the filtering based on resource metadata going to occur?  Why only return one resource?  What if that one resource does not match the metadata requirements?'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2016-03-02 19:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think you may be misunderstanding the implementation. The code block starting at line 36 does provide the filtering by metadata. Any extra parameters (which are contained in kwargs) are treated as metadata filters, which are applied in this block.

In this iteration of the implementation, the purpose of the ResourceProvider is to filter resources based on metadata and used resources, while the ResourceTracker has the responsibility of tracking the resources used and acting as the façade for the tests to interact with. This was the understanding I left the midcycle with after we decided that the first iteration of the solution was more complex than originally planned.

If Andrea also agrees that the solution I've provided here does not match what we discussed Wednesday, then we should re-group and come to a common understanding with class diagrams before going further. I'm not attached to any specific implementation of this spec, but I would prefer not to iterate over this more than is necessary."}, {'account_id': 8001, 'date': '2016-03-02 21:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

My mistake.  I thought it would have been good to keep the filtering by metadata separate from tracking the used resources but I see why you have it the way you do.'}, {'account_id': 9364, 'date': '2016-03-08 22:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-09 00:24:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Adds the ResourceProvider class

Adds the ResourceProvider class, which builds on the
ResourceConfiguration class by providing filtering logic.

Partially implements blueprint tempest-resources

Change-Id: I768ce5954ac09c68a0634fb241bbbc69e1d7bb19

commit_message:
Update refs to primary creds in base test

This change updates the references to the primary credentials
in the base test case and makes the necessary changes in
inherting classes to ensure that the setup of validation
resources still works correctly.

partially implements blueprint simplify-credentials-management

Change-Id: I06af71edef8e5c0cce8446d2fff5b67ea61a9c0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-02-25 08:31:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh

For example:
You have two networks and two servers:
First server is connected to both networks and can
be reached from world by floating ip.
Second server and network can be reached only from
first server.
In case you need to run command on second
server from tests-you can use this function to do it.
Usual exec_command does not support this feature.

Change-Id: If13301bc2df30d02c0a2e37b3e908c0fa199e6c7
'}]
commit_message:
Add function to execute command on remote server via ssh

For example:
You have two networks and two servers:
First server is connected to both networks and can
be reached from world by floating ip.
Second server and network can be reached only from
first server.
In case you need to run command on second
server from tests-you can use this function to do it.
Usual exec_command does not support this feature.

Change-Id: If13301bc2df30d02c0a2e37b3e908c0fa199e6c7

commit_message:
[OSC] Fix the default API_VERSION in unit tests

The API_VERSION in some unit tests for OSC share commands
are set to API microversion 2.51. However, the default value
should be set to MAX_VERSION so the tests would be aligned
with the latest defined microversion.

This patch was submitted during the GHC2021 Summer OSD

Closes-Bug: #1913956
Change-Id: Ibb8c373dbb4620ea8e67d85f641a708162f06d64

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-21 23:31:19.000000000', 'message': 'Use older run-tempest for stable branches

run-tempest is changed recently to add the new variables but
keep supporting the old ones too, for example:
tempest_black_regex, tempest_exclude_regex. and if both
old and new var are used in job definition (parent and child) then
new variables are picked. Because Tempest is branchless, zuul pick
the Tempest master playbooks/roles. That is why job running on stable
branch gate will pick the base job definition from Tempest master.
This way if any stable jobs which were defining the old var and using old
Tempest are broken if any of their parent job define the new var.

This commit pin the older run-tempest role for such stable branches.

Change-Id: If49ab0c31aca5b7837636727096a9bc83f891b1b

commit_message:
Use older run-tempest for stable branches

run-tempest is changed recently to add the new variables but
keep supporting the old ones too, for example:
tempest_black_regex, tempest_exclude_regex. and if both
old and new var are used in job definition (parent and child) then
new variables are picked. Because Tempest is branchless, zuul pick
the Tempest master playbooks/roles. That is why job running on stable
branch gate will pick the base job definition from Tempest master.
This way if any stable jobs which were defining the old var and using old
Tempest are broken if any of their parent job define the new var.

This commit pin the older run-tempest role for such stable branches.

Change-Id: If49ab0c31aca5b7837636727096a9bc83f891b1b

commit_message:
Handle use-internal-endpoints properly.

The ironic conductor, by default, will use internal endpoints when
communicating with other services such as nova, keystone, etc. The
use-internal-endpoints config option in the charm doesn't update the
configuration for the valid_interfaces that the clients should use
when communicating with other services. This change sets the
internal_endpoints option explicitly to honor the charm setting.

Closes-Bug: #1934907
Change-Id: I235391737858d9f7b3ee1e352bbcb1704c52af32

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-15 08:59:08.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)

[{'created': '2021-07-15 08:59:41.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)

Just a rebase; maybe more relevant in light of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633094/ ?'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-07-29 12:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-07-29 16:20:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

The main reason I brought this up on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/633094/ was that pipeline order is going to matter when making a hard link to a manifest. It's definitely something we'll need to keep in mind as we move to symlink-backed versioning, though."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-07-31 14:50:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

I think codifying these ordering dependencies explicitly instead of implicitly in the example configs is extremely helpful - KUDOS.

I don't think the right direction to deal with our legacy of not doing enough to help deployers and operators with their very real struggle against pipeline complexity is to prevent them from upgrading their clusters until they fix their pipelines.

I'm fairly sure we've discussed this with operators at summits, my recollection and understanding was that they want is the upstream team to maintain a config-check tool that can identify problems and provides recommendations for an explicit pipeline

Also my recollection and understanding is that they also want configs that "worked" with Swift N-1 to still "work" when they upgrade to N'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-07-15 20:21:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

Oh hey, looks like I had some old draft comments kicking around.'}]

commit_message:
Include some pipeline validation during proxy-server start-up

There are a variety of known-bad middleware configurations which can
lead to non-functioning features, broken container listings, or even the
loss of data availability. Flag such configurations early and prevent
the proxy-server from starting.

Note that memcache got added to a bunch of after_fn return values
because we would mis-place listing_formats and dlo in the
widely-used-in-tests pipeline:

    pipeline = catch_errors cache proxy-server

Change-Id: Ib47ecc945b5a8960b5d74ce165f0d5f9a131ed56
Partial-Bug: 1813725
Closes-Bug: 1758710
Closes-Bug: 1806468

messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-05-27 07:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-05-27 20:58:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Not sure what's up with the Python version for the func tests, but we ought to either fix it, or change the names.

I also proposed https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/793503 to help us figure out what version of Python we're running for the probe tests. (I'm guessing 3.6, like the x86 job?)

Given that these tests all pass, what do we think about making them voting?"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-06-01 01:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add some more arm64 non-voting tests

Adds:
 - a centos-8 probe test on py36
 - an ubuntu-bionic functest on py38
 - an ubuntu-bionic functest with encryption on py38

Change-Id: Id835b49312ec04d7ce9094718b98d8e23ddba0b7

commit_message:
Add parameters for image copy when using multiple RBD Glance stores

Expose the Nova config options to allow an image to be automatically
copied into the local Glance store when Glance is configured to use
multiple RBD stores.

Related Nova change: Ia839ad418b0f2887cb8e8f5ee3e660a0751db9ce

Change-Id: I227f40111591cfe1026ce992b3de3e28d092f329
(cherry picked from commit 920f2fbf7e1d455b0f8ab0e7655dc576e0642cd7)

commit_message:
Switch get(full)argspec function according to python version

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

This change ensures that inspect.getfullargspec is used in Python 3.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: I63a4fda4f5da00c0f752e58f2e7192baea5012bb

(2 comments)

I have some small questions.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-07-13 18:32:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(3 comments)

this is really three changes in one

1) add concurrency to the reconciler so it can do more than one queue entry at a time (sometimes swift requests take awhile, a single reconciler can work on another of it's assigned queue entries while waiting on others)

2) multi-process reconciler, proccess/process is a proven pattern with the expirer

3) crazy new startup interval scheduling and process coverage, which one could apply justify should be applied to the expirer procs as well

Maybe I should break it down!!!"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-07-13 18:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-07-13 19:57:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(15 comments)

The multinode and greenpool changes make sense -- I haven't really dug into the "crazy new startup interval scheduling" change yet.

I also wonder if we should force some kind of delay before we start processing items off the "covered" queues -- like, give the primary guy an hour or two to get things moved, then the first backup gets a chance to help, and after 2-4hrs the second backup kicks in. I think that should mostly eliminate the concurrent writes from the reconciler. Definitely a bit trickier to implement, though.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-07-14 02:56:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

oh nice a rebase is it. I've got a local rebased version of the wip patch on top of it, as it cleanly sits on master without this. and am using it to test sharding + reconcoler. (doesn't work on shard containers obvously). But talked to Al on Monday, so will have something to grab extra metadata from the root soon that could help solve that and potentially help with Al's bucket inventories."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-07-15 18:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Workflow-1

this needs a rebase on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/800850 once we get tests passing over there'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-01 07:50:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for multiple container-reconciler

This change enables a cluster operator to coordinate multiple
distributed container-reconciler processes.  The implementation
continues to follow similar patterns as the object-expirier, with some
differences.  Like the object-expirer the total number of
container-reconciler "processes" for the cluster and a per config
"process" create a modulo process "ring" into which work can be
sub-divided.  Unlike the object-expirer, each process calculates a
staggered schedule so that the entire process pool will check for
misplaced objects at the configured interval in a steady state system.
Also, the first process to notice new entries in the queue will attempt
to complete all available work processing up to the configured
concurrency setting objects simultaneously, which should keep the time
to recovery as low as possible when there is a nominal amount of work to
perform.  If the process does not complete processing all queue items
before the end of it's interval it will begin skipping some queue
entries based on their hash modulo the number of processes compared with
the configured processes.  The next process to start will similarly
begin processing all entries before also settling into only processing
the subset of the available work for which it is responsible.

See `etc/container-reconciler.conf` for configuration details.

Change-Id: I10e3d1ffb4d70a6f998a9c84eba4ce17a068039b

commit_message:
Add support for multiple container-reconciler

This change enables a cluster operator to coordinate multiple
distributed container-reconciler processes.  The implementation
continues to follow similar patterns as the object-expirier, with some
differences.  Like the object-expirer the total number of
container-reconciler "processes" for the cluster and a per config
"process" create a modulo process "ring" into which work can be
sub-divided.  Unlike the object-expirer, each process calculates a
staggered schedule so that the entire process pool will check for
misplaced objects at the configured interval in a steady state system.
Also, the first process to notice new entries in the queue will attempt
to complete all available work processing up to the configured
concurrency setting objects simultaneously, which should keep the time
to recovery as low as possible when there is a nominal amount of work to
perform.  If the process does not complete processing all queue items
before the end of it's interval it will begin skipping some queue
entries based on their hash modulo the number of processes compared with
the configured processes.  The next process to start will similarly
begin processing all entries before also settling into only processing
the subset of the available work for which it is responsible.

See `etc/container-reconciler.conf` for configuration details.

Change-Id: I10e3d1ffb4d70a6f998a9c84eba4ce17a068039b

Go over what needs to be done when a MySQL InnoDB
Cluster is restarted. It involves running a single
action.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-15 08:58:46.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

This patch adds the RpcWorker back to the list of workers that should
connect to the OVN databases.

Change-Id: I454f3b52376a02f6cc9ca9124083295631bd03d5
Closes-Bug: #1929633
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e5f19a29dcfb70ea08fa39267bc4aecd44bec2eb)

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated oslo.db options

oslo.db 10.0.0 finally removes the deprecated '[database] idle_timeout'
option in favour of '[database] connection_recycle_time'. Update unit
tests to reflect this.

Change-Id: I3628f1cd438f3f2ca999ec89df4eef989c903b95
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add devstack local.conf sample for ML2 OVS

Since devstack had set OVN as the default backend for Neutron.
Then the minimum local.conf [1] for ML2 ovs will not work at
all. For some local testing of ML2 OVS, it is not right deployment
for users to test the ML2 OVS related cases.

This patch adds a sample local.conf for ml2 ovs to install a small
all in one environment for Neutron testing.

Sample tested OS:
1. CentOS Stream 8
2. CentOS Linux 8

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/#create-a-local-conf

Closes-Bug: #1934466
Change-Id: Ie7bac1d2819c332a94a0ff308a300638c17f1b1f

commit_message:
Switch identity roles in the cloud layer to proxy

Now the roles operations including role assignments are switched to be
using proxy layer instead of reimplementing REST calls.

Change-Id: I74d9202ed452fdbba558b0a4b708bffeea6b266b

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I2e6521c9f0c6a0885692edc485659b420828a2d2

commit_message:
Loosen version pin to bind cookbook

They still haven't released the cookbook however they've updated the release to
3.1.0 which is breaking tests globally. This should resolve the issue.

Also apply fixes for using the resolver 3.x cookbook.

Change-Id: I5b0a6783f0602983baeaf8b0e9bb90f150212644
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-chef/+/800841
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-06 15:22:24.000000000', 'message': "docs: Fix failing build

This is failing because the docstring for this attribute that we're
inheriting from sqlalchemy refers to a 'ref' that doesn't exist in our
tree. The solution is to simply override the docstring.

Change-Id: I7210848d45fb8651db63f1be8a194ce0ffc2bfac
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Fix failing build

This is failing because the docstring for this attribute that we're
inheriting from sqlalchemy refers to a 'ref' that doesn't exist in our
tree. The solution is to simply override the docstring.

Change-Id: I7210848d45fb8651db63f1be8a194ce0ffc2bfac
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Add feature branch notifications to openstack-sdks

notify the channel if there's activity on this branch.

commit_message:
Create repo for Hashicorp Vault deployment

As part of implementation of the spec [1] we aim to offer basic Vault
deployment out of the box as a tooling required for providing such
kind of feature.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs/specs/xena/protecting-plaintext-configs.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/799822
Change-Id: Iaa3ad26f4bbaa4c3693b16a87e7d938862c59ab0

commit_message:
Fix playbook_dir Ansible Warning

This change removes the jinja found within the conditionals used in our
deploy steps playbook which will resolve an Ansible warning seen when
running a deployment.

Change-Id: Ifa66a0805cba5c5a095731bda5e4f8c31626ed96
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

> I think all horizon UI components could move to EOL at the same time; there's no real benefit of manila-ui continuing to keep its stable/queens branch under EM. I'll bring this up to the manila team meeting on 15th July at 1500 UTC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Manila/Meetings

Ok thanks, that would be great."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-15 16:07:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Hi Vishal, we've agreed to eol this branch as discussed: 

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/800963 
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-July/023660.html"}]

commit_message:
Define horizon-django jobs

manila-ui stable/queens branch uses horizon-django job template [1] to run
django-jobs but horizon team decided to move stable/queens to EOL [2] and
as mentioned in [3] doc. we either need to removes that job or move the
job definition in stable/queens manila-ui branch. So this patch imports
the required zuul job from horizon ``.zuul.yaml`` .

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/stable/queens/.zuul.yaml#L114-L115
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/799543
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#end-of-life

Change-Id: Ifcd05c9bd92f1b156c26dbaba2eff3e033e59e35

commit_message:
Use same config download method as overcloud for tripleo deploy

We currently re-implement what the download_config function does in
tripleo-common. Let's just reuse that function to align better with what
the overcloud does.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/798153
Change-Id: Idc66d711ca7f4ce6369e38526257b887b9bc7dfd

commit_message:
Error anti-affinity violation on migrations

Error-out the migrations (cold and live) whenever the
anti-affinity policy is violated. This addresses
violations when multiple concurrent migrations are
requested.

Added detection on:
- prep_resize
- check_can_live_migration_destination
- pre_live_migration

The improved method of detection now locks based on group_id
and considers other migrations in-progress as well.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE: Conflicts are because the following changes are not in Stein:

  * Ia00277ac8a68a635db85f9e0ce2c6d8df396e0d8 (Set migrate_data.vifs only when using multiple port bindings)
  * I3c917796cb30d11e7db1e235ac1625d2a743aaa2 (NUMA live migration support)
  * I2f3434f06489d8b6cb80933bcb1ea1e841049ba5 (Support migrating SRIOV port with bandwidth)
  * I292a0e2d840bbf657ba6d0932f9a3decbcb2778f ([FUP] Follow-up patch for SR-IOV live migration)
  * I734cc01dce13f9e75a16639faf890ddb1661b7eb (SR-IOV Live migration indirect port support)

Summary of conflicts:

Cherry-picked pulled many non-related newer unit tests.
Cleaned those up and adjusted:
- Removed 2 extra params of check_can_live_migrate_destination
  invocations.
- Adjusted request_spec variable of
  unit test test_prep_resize_errors_migration.
- Removed extra tab spacing on a unit test.

Closes-bug: #1821755
Change-Id: I32e6214568bb57f7613ddeba2c2c46da0320fabc
(cherry picked from commit 33c8af1f8c46c9c37fcc28fb3409fbd3a78ae39f)
(cherry picked from commit 8b62a4ec9bf617dfb2da046c25a9f76b33516508)
(cherry picked from commit 6ede6df7f41db809de19e124d3d4994180598f19)
(cherry picked from commit bf90a1e06181f6b328b967124e538c6e2579b2e5)
(cherry picked from commit a22d1b04de9e6ebc33b5ab9871b86f8e4022e7a9)

- expose domain role mgmt in proxy

- fix return code for role mgmt to be 204, what is the proper one
  (according to ref specs, tests of the cloud layer, etc)

'}, {'created': '2021-05-12 15:49:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix identity role management

unit tests.
- expose domain role mgmt in proxy
- add unit tests in proxy for domain and project role mgmt
- add unit tests in domain and proxy for role mgmt functions
- fix return code for role mgmt to be 204, what is the proper one

commit_message:
Fix identity role management

Domain role management was not exposed in the proxy. There were also no
unit tests.
- expose domain role mgmt in proxy
- add unit tests in proxy for domain and project role mgmt
- add unit tests in domain and proxy for role mgmt functions
- fix return code for role mgmt to be 204, what is the proper one
  (according to ref specs, tests of the cloud layer, etc)

Change-Id: If5f6ea5ee043601e46cf30d7c126cefaa2ba7d06

commit_message:
Switch identiy.endpoints in the cloud layer

cloud layer for identity.endpoint is now going to proxy layer without
reimplementing requests. Stip out further v2 parts from identity cloud
layer.

Change-Id: Ifa078a319b383855744b82678b508b85f46b3691

commit_message:
Switch identity.service in cloud layer to proxy

Switch service methods to rely on proxy instead of reimplementing
requests directly.
Also here drop v2 support (also for endpoint tests due to dependency).

Change-Id: Ic856855f8040f88e618926bf0fdf14b0daa589d9

commit_message:
Improvements to federation packaging

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages
being present at any time to avoid conflicts.

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d

subject: [DNM] Replace all 'python' to 'python3' of shell script
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27738, 'name': 'mashuting', 'email': 'shutingm@vmware.com', 'username': 'mashuting'}, {'_account_id': 29963, 'name': 'Intel_Zuul', 'display_name': 'Intel Corporation CI', 'email': 'intel-openstack-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'Intel_Zuul'}, {'_account_id': 32071, 'name': 'Hui Jiang', 'email': 'jhui@vmware.com', 'username': 'jhui'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-06 08:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-06 11:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This breaks the centos-7 platform job, which is still running python2 only by default. Might not be a bad idea to drop that job and wait for a working centos-8 job, though.

Also note that the sdk job is broken by novaclient currently, no need to recheck for now.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-07 04:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This breaks the centos-7 platform job, which is still running
 > python2 only by default. Might not be a bad idea to drop that job
 > and wait for a working centos-8 job, though.
 > 
 > Also note that the sdk job is broken by novaclient currently, no
 > need to recheck for now.

Thanks for your advise! 
I found that the devstack's code will execute python installation,if the env does not have python2 installed and python is the default python installation, it will install python2 and set it as default, so executing 'python -c' will be blocked.
Or we can change the python installation to python3, I cannot make sure which way is better to fix the bug.
Please help to follow up on this patch~"}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-12 08:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-11-14 06:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

You probably need this change to fix centos 7 job failure.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-11-14 06:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

You should probably disable c-api service for passing neutron-grenade job.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-11-14 06:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

To fix centos 7 job failute you should probably require below change:

 https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688799/5'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-11-14 06:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Why not taking python command name from a global variable?
Example:

 function detect_python() {
     which python3 || which python
 }

 PYTHON=${PYTHON:-(find_python)}

Then you could replace all "python" entries with "$PYTHON"'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-14 07:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Why not taking python command name from a global variable?
 > Example:
 > 
 > function detect_python() {
 > which python3 || which python
 > }
 > 
 > PYTHON=${PYTHON:-(find_python)}
 > 
 > Then you could replace all "python" entries with "$PYTHON"

Thanks! That's a brilliant idea, will have a try!'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-14 07:24:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-15 04:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-15 06:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-11-15 08:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-15 10:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

Is upstream CI still running with python2?'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-11-15 11:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

The problem of this implementation is that it requires install_python3 to be called to make things works. There are two considerations to make here:

- The PYTHON3 variable could be called before install_python3 function is called.- 
- You need CentOS 7 to support python3 to make it working (work in progress).

Therefore I would replace the variable with a function that call python. I then would always call python using given function. Please have a look to below script as an example how to archive it:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/694516/2/tools/ci/python

The script looks at available pythons matching the version secified as PYTHON_VERSION. Then it would use such executable every time python function is called.

For example PYTHON_VERSION=3 would take the first python 3 found,
while PYTHON_VERSION=3.6 will skip any python3 that has other version than 3.6

If you decide to reuse it please note you have to remove below statements:

 source $(dirname "$0")/activate'  # (at the top)
 PATH=${CI_TOOLS_ORIGINAL_PATH}' # in python_version function
 python "$@" # at the bottom'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-18 10:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-18 11:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-19 03:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-19 04:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-20 03:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-21 04:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-21 06:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-11-21 09:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

As we run python3 by default, I think we should get back to the original version of this patch, combined with installing python3 unconditionally instead of python2. This could also resolve the discussion in https://review.opendev.org/688799 .'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-22 08:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> As we run python3 by default, I think we should get back to the
 > original version of this patch, combined with installing python3
 > unconditionally instead of python2. This could also resolve the
 > discussion in https://review.opendev.org/688799 .

Sure, if you decide to always install python3, I will roll back to patchset 5'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-11-26 03:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-12-04 12:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-12-05 07:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-12-06 03:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27738, 'date': '2019-12-06 03:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-12-09 09:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

commit_message:
[DNM] Replace all 'python' to 'python3' of shell script

We already removed the fallback installation of the python 2 libraries,
so using 'python -c' in shell script will fail because of ImportError.
Related patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681029/

Change-Id: I9a524f3395b3d84a5c280131f68edbf9bae052a1

commit_message:
Remove skipped tests from very older releases

Since Newton, Ocata, Pike branches got EOL long time ago,
so we are cleaning up this from skip list.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure all test bundles pick up vip from overlay

All of the test bundles deploy ironic-api in HA with hacluster,
however the bundles were using individual overlays that required
new overlays to be defined for each new bundle. Instead, let's
use a single local-charm-overlay.yaml.j2. This handles the
situation similar to how charm-octavia does.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-ironic-api/+/799098
Closes-Bug: #1934382
Change-Id: If79f39ad8a866494edbe1c6b61e233bd6f3adbd7

commit_message:
Fix manila-cephfsganesha-config environment for cephadm

The composable service is located in deployment/cephadm/cephadm.yaml,
not the one previously mentioned.

This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: I7a919ae6d00994d433e03b3304722abccac8dc2a
(cherry picked from commit 61ffbe98958e50133aae3fba51a79a1ca6804d77)

commit_message:
Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (currently ussuri) are removed.

Change-Id: I9a1b9f004c379f2b5f150ae0bb0ee89457cf486a

messages: [{'account_id': 30615, 'date': '2021-07-12 06:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2021-07-12 07:29:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-07-15 12:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-12 06:14:10.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ie59f37d798873da90fb4b2c25699c2f4c62531ba
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ie59f37d798873da90fb4b2c25699c2f4c62531ba

f7d84db587 [neutron] Get only ID and name of the SGs from Neutron

e3085fa631 Initialize global data separately and run_once in WSGI app init

0405709999 rbd: Get rbd_utils unit tests running again
90ffc553d7 Ignore PCI devices with 32bit domain
0354d4d9f4 Reproduce bug 1897528

Change-Id: Ibc960d6ca3f9bcd05079f374df7ebfde7a2882bd

commit_message:
uwsgi_config: Use init_setting, not openstacksetting

The way the patch was sent, it always want to change the magnum uwsgi
file on each run. This fixes it.

Change-Id: I1f2910686216d3ce3cf6dab41d3bdc7a52606f87

commit_message:
Remove tempest test from skiplist

This patch will remove the tesmpest tests from skiplist
which are having green run (more than 10 times) in the
last/previous runs.

Closes-Bug: #1728886
Closes-Bug: #1921400
Closes-Bug: #1926647
Closes-Bug: #1926992
Change-Id: I2904bbb4c4b29f7008d98da58eb6304849ba9608

Change-Id: I9a6941eccebf65da4df90b95a1dc36f9bca40dc1
"}]
commit_message:
Add NVIDIA GPU driver specification

This spec proposes to provide the initial design for
Cyborg's NVIDIA pGPU driver.

Change-Id: I9a6941eccebf65da4df90b95a1dc36f9bca40dc1

commit_message:
rebuild - restore proxy env vars for add-apt-repository

Also override bundles in osci.yaml as wallaby+ bundles
don't exist in stable branch.

don't exist in stable branch.

commit_message:
nova: Release Wallaby 23.0.2

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 23.0.1..HEAD
fef0305abe Move 'check-cherry-picks' test to gate, n-v check
5d65680095 libvirt: Set driver_iommu when attaching virtio devices to SEV instance
c45bedd98d zuul: Replace grenade and nova-grenade-multinode with grenade-multinode
8b62a4ec9b Error anti-affinity violation on migrations
46aa3f4ec7 Honor [neutron]http_retries in the manual client
bf7254b794 Update SRIOV port pci_slot when unshelving
3625d5336a Test SRIOV port move operations with PCI conflicts
83ca8b3563 Neutron fixture: don't clobber profile and vif_details if empty
5ede75c65e Stop leaking ceph df cmd in RBD utils
4709256142 Reject open redirection in the console proxy
8f018d754d rbd: Get rbd_utils unit tests running again
8b50f48ed2 Consolidate device detach error handling
ebf1ceb7d6 Move instance power state check to _detach_with_retry
14596ca30f libvirt: Remove dead error handling code
9f90c7268c Follow up type hints for a634103
3fcd11a403 Enable mypy on libvirt/guest.py
5f488d8cd1 Move the guest.get_disk test to test_guest
30317e6b3f Replace blind retry with libvirt event waiting in detach

Change-Id: I80ebeb273213d25862befa8fa51990d993b7a3a4

commit_message:
tests: Silence SQLAlchemy warnings

While we wait for keystone to merge the patch to unblock oslo.db 10.0.0,
silence these warnings from newer versions of SQLAlchemy. TODOs are left
since we don't want to keep these around forever.

Change-Id: If48dd949ec4d69a09c87178f16d56a2517e21fd8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

repository during the queens release. This repo is already
deprecated and now we can retire it. This patch removes all

commit_message:
Retire django-openstack-auth - Step 1: Stop requirements syncing

``django_openstack_auth`` code was merged into the main horizon
repository during the queens release. This repo is already
deprecated and now we can retire it. This patch removes all
references of ``django_openstack_auth`` as mentioned in [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: I3b5fa373e2521b05dae6061c7ede0ea749888f18

function annotations and keyword-only parameters.

commit_message:
Do not generate password for unsupported services

The following services are no longer supported by TripleO and generated
passwords are no longer used.

- Congress
- EC2 API
- Panko
- Sahara

Change-Id: I0829edb19b8e1614b8000db7355fe6368bc169d7

commit_message:
Move placement specs from nova

Mistakenly the computing team merged two specs in nova that actually
targeting the placement service. Placement has its own specs directory
to store these. So this patch adds the these specs to the placement
repository.

The only change in the two specifications compared the ones approved in
nova-specs repository is the removal of the note from the top that they
are targeting placement service as it is now obvious.

Change-Id: Ie0d4df94ae16de60394438878e5a1568e29e03a5

commit_message:
Skips attaching interface if interface_attach config option is False

The test_tagged_attachment test is hotplugging a NIC into an instance,
but not all VMs supports this (e.g.: Hyper-V Server 2012 R2 or older, or
Hyper-V Generation 1 VMs), causing this test to fail.

This patch skips attaching a NIC in the test if the
CONF.compute_feature_enabled.interface_attach config option is set to
False (it is True by default).

Change-Id: I426bd8a1bc1df5c7ace02782879aad5c269389be

commit_message:
Enable image copy for multiple RBD Glance stores

Previously when using multiple RBD glance stores the operator was
responsible for copying the image to all stores.
Nova-compute now has the ability to automatically copy an image to the
local glance store when required.
This change enables the feature and adds the following role specific
parameters to control the behaviour:
  NovaGlanceRbdCopyPollInterval
  NovaGlanceRbdCopyTimeout

Related Nova change: Ia839ad418b0f2887cb8e8f5ee3e660a0751db9ce

Depends-On: I227f40111591cfe1026ce992b3de3e28d092f329
Change-Id: If7532022f399115357f1fdfa9a510d615ed55609

commit_message:
Tag stable/queens tripleo repos as EOL

As discussed at [1] this tags the last commits to the
stable/queens branch as queens-eol for tripleo repos [2].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-June/023115.html
[2] https://releases.openstack.org/teams/tripleo.html#queens

Change-Id: I5893202c31dfadbe5009a87f4e545787fd065368

subject: WIP: Handle update/upgrade while sriov_pf is attached to the guest
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-15 05:21:27.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Handle update/upgrade while sriov_pf is attached to the guest

If stack upgrade/updates are performed while a  sriov_pf device is
still associated with the guest, the PF reconfiguration shall be
safely avoided so that update or upgrades shall proceed without failing

Change-Id: Idd4d968092ba84a1c6a183cac39112f5ff9ae360
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Handle update/upgrade while sriov_pf is attached to the guest

If stack upgrade/updates are performed while a  sriov_pf device is
still associated with the guest, the PF reconfiguration shall be
safely avoided so that update or upgrades shall proceed without failing

Change-Id: Idd4d968092ba84a1c6a183cac39112f5ff9ae360

and we will process a release. If you need to get some important
changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with a new
commit hash to use once it is ready.

commit_message:
Xena-2 Release for castellan

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for castellan.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates
are made available.

If you are happy with the current release hash, please +1 this patch
and we will process a release. If you need to get some important
changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with a new
commit hash to use once it is ready.

If a release is definitely not wanted at this time, please -1 and
leave a comment explaining that and we can abandon the patch.

Any patches with no response will be assumed to be OK and will be
processed by July 15.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.8.0..17cd833
1620394 barbican key manager: Add support for service user
2073f45 Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0
0d0c2f2 Add missing font for PDF doc generation

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4b7b3504426732f162c40502e8608102fa46df38

[{'created': '2021-07-14 13:01:10.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

Note this fix is different from the master branch. Reason being, the
master branch included a new configuration option [0] that we could
leverage to fix this problem but that is not backportable as our guideline
do not allow for new features to be backported (and config options).

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/795781

Closes-Bug: #1929633
Closes-Bug: #1935983

Change-Id: I1a14f217d0b6bca84cd074ef5aa4e07797fdf7e0
(cherry picked from commit 256ed3b72fa5b2a8030814e9e6cf299a887ea9b7)

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

Note this fix is different from the master branch. Reason being, the
master branch included a new configuration option [0] that we could
leverage to fix this problem but that is not backportable as our guideline
do not allow for new features to be backported (and config options).

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/795781

Closes-Bug: #1929633
Closes-Bug: #1935983
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1a14f217d0b6bca84cd074ef5aa4e07797fdf7e0
(cherry picked from commit 256ed3b72fa5b2a8030814e9e6cf299a887ea9b7)

commit_message:
Fix charm so that on focal it uses named service

This is a cherry-pick/squash of three commits:

 8949ab2 Switch Helper to use c.openstack PatchHelper
 ba7e3ac Fix charm so that on focal it uses named service
 5205bce Fix charm so that on focal it uses named service - 2

For the purposes of the backport, they have been squashed into this
single commit.  The Change-Id is from ba7e3ac.

Original commit messages (minus change ids):

ba7e3ac Fix charm so that on focal it uses named service

Pre-focal the service was called 'bind9'.  On focal+ it is called
'named'.  This patch introduces a number of changes to make this
possible:

 * Modify existing charm class "DesignateBindCharm" to include a check
   to see if the distro version is "focal" or higher; if so switch
   the service name to 'named'.

8949ab2 Switch Helper to use c.openstack PatchHelper

Switch Helper to use c.openstack PatchHelper

This charms.openstack PatchHelper class is a better version of the
Helper class in test_lib_charm_openstack_designate_bind.py as it allows
patching by fully qualified class string.  This simplifies the patching
in the tests.

Change-Id: Ida65c620fa81715d37e468217aea28f160cf31ee
Closes-Bug: #1929770

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-03 23:59:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix oslo policy DeprecatedRule warnings

Since 3.7.0, oslo policy started the DeprecationWarning[1] if
deprecated_reason and deprecated_since param are not passed
in DeprecatedRule or they are passed in RuleDefault object.

These warnings are logged for every test which increase the
log size and sometime can full the log buffer and fail the
job.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/3.7.0/oslo_policy/policy.py#L1538

commit_message:
Fix oslo policy DeprecatedRule warnings

Since 3.7.0, oslo policy started the DeprecationWarning[1] if
deprecated_reason and deprecated_since param are not passed
in DeprecatedRule or they are passed in RuleDefault object.

These warnings are logged for every test which increase the
log size and sometime can full the log buffer and fail the
job.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.policy/blob/3.7.0/oslo_policy/policy.py#L1538

Change-Id: Ifa8c620fe76517b1c040af5905e6a6c1cdb4c922

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

Note this fix is different from the master branch. Reason being, the
master branch included a new configuration option [0] that we could
leverage to fix this problem but that is not backportable as our
guideline
do not allow for new features to be backported (and config options).

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/795781

(manually cherry picked from Neutron 256ed3b72fa5b2a8030814e9e6cf299a887ea9b7)

Closes-Bug: #1929633
Closes-Bug: #1935983
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1a14f217d0b6bca84cd074ef5aa4e07797fdf7e0

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent use case

In an attempt to minimize the number of connections to the OVSDBs the
ML2/OVN driver stopped connecting to the OVN dbs if the Neutron worker
was a RpcWorker but, that introduced a regression for those using
ML2/OVN + Neutron DHCP agent (for baremetal provisioning).

Because the RpcWorker didn't have a connection to the OVN database the
Neutron DHCP agent wasn't able to create the DHCP port and failed with:

2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers if not
self._sb_ovn.chassis_exists(host):
2021-07-13 13:36:18.116 17 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.managers
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'chassis_exists'

Note this fix is different from the master branch. Reason being, the
master branch included a new configuration option [0] that we could
leverage to fix this problem but that is not backportable as our guideline
do not allow for new features to be backported (and config options).

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/795781

commit_message:
Reduce logging verbosity when collecting logs

It's not uncommon that some commands fail when collecting logs.
We already log all failures in utils.execute, no need to duplicate
them with a non-fatal ERROR logging.

Change-Id: If151b3a3be979bd2b3ce01030e5d6242ad74eaa3
(cherry picked from commit 2fcf35e56d578d98d77ffc97b6441f83548d7704)

commit_message:
Temp mark undercloud-upgrade-wallaby non voting for swift bug

The undercloud-upgrade-wallaby job is hitting suspected race
condition from related bug. We should mark it non voting to
unblock the gate until the bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I73be2188b104568ced2296642032902830e7a175
Related-Bug: 1935961

commit_message:
[OVN] Conditionally init OVN IDL for RPC workers

The OVN driver owns ports and provides DHCP- and Metadata-
services to consumers of the sriovnicsiwtch mechanism driver.

At this point in time the sriovnicswitch driver relies on an
agent and RPC and as such we need to conditionally initialize
OVN IDL connections even for RPC workers.

Closes-Bug: #1931244
Related-Bug: #1927977
Change-Id: Id849e8ca6795131bb760b96e40e24c1d8a3a116b

commit_message:
Add tool to convert net-data from v1 to v2

This new tool will convert the old v1 net-data format to v2. This tool
will create a backup of the older net-data file so that its possible to
recover data should anything go wrong in the conversion. Upon completion
the tool will create the v2 file using the existing file format name.

Change-Id: I4b4d79b0f68287921fedb3ad7b29b50df5ae3f02
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove publish-to-pypi from retired neutron-lbaas repo

neutron-lbaas and neuteon-lbaas-dashboard are retired
in train cycle but not properly.

This commit remove the publish-to-pypi job from these repo so that
we can merge the README.rst update. In next patch, complete setup
will be removed from project-config.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lbaas/+/800143
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard/+/800144
Change-Id: I9bc3efa4963cac626fc99a58169337adf45f42c3

commit_message:
Wire up the tripleo-upgrades-wallaby-pipeline

This wires up the wallaby upgrades jobs added in tripleo-ci depends-on.
See topic branch [1] for related patches. The tripleo-heat-templates
depends-on is needed to fix a bug with the undercloud upgrade.

https://f060d8f7c95f0c48ac2e-8605f807f0b1cdc197533279c15edd0d.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/789405/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider/2d8ec0c/job-output.txt
```
2021-07-14 11:48:35.925395 | primary | 127.0.0.1:5001/tripleou/centos-binary-cinder-volume                35b6344febd6a9625d2e8e1a1913d13a              7208b2068d5f   3 hours ago     1.24 GB
```

The upgrade job failing: https://2863c2f6d7448fef1a75-907323b417218f46df6192f35c6995f8.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/789405/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-standalone-upgrade-ussuri/54303b5/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone_upgrade.log
```
Error initializing source docker://104.239.136.196:5001/tripleou/centos-binary-cinder-volume:6cac0c0d0530502841b4b0443ac09495
```
It is pulling previous-current-tripleo, As per the job definition
https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/src/branch/master/zuul.d/upgrades-jobs-templates.yaml#L186
```
tripleo-ci-centos-8-standalone-upgrade-ussuri:
            vars: *consumer_vars
            dependencies:
              - tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider
              - tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider-train
```

Upgrade job will start only when both content provider finishes, since ussuri content provider has correct current-tripleo hash but upgrade job is pulling containers from previous-current-tripleo not sure why?
As the mirrors already have the same content.

It needs to be debugged.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2021-07-14 16:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck mirrors appear to be synced.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-03 18:47:32.000000000', 'message': 'Create post-deploy.conf on update/upgrade for octavia

Containers are restarted with new command lines during upgrade/updates
before the external_deploy_task are run that create a configuration file
that is used on the command line. This results in octavia services
failing to start.

Note: this was originally merged as:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750986/
but the OctaviaBase references in templates was incorrect so the
original patch was reverted through:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763561/
As the original patch had not been backported, it makes more sense to
revert and get a correct fix in place and backport that instead of
requiring backporting a series or backporting a squashed commit.

Conflicts:
  deployment/octavia/octavia-api-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ib3476e53f89b50bae72b9c95a5d3dec51ed3de7e
Related-Bug: #1863595
(cherry picked from commit 6c11a949fc0b940ebc3815aeb86156bd60df5851)
'}]
commit_message:
Create post-deploy.conf on update/upgrade for octavia

Containers are restarted with new command lines during upgrade/updates
before the external_deploy_task are run that create a configuration file
that is used on the command line. This results in octavia services
failing to start.

Note: this was originally merged as:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/750986/
but the OctaviaBase references in templates was incorrect so the
original patch was reverted through:
    https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763561/
As the original patch had not been backported, it makes more sense to
revert and get a correct fix in place and backport that instead of
requiring backporting a series or backporting a squashed commit.

Conflicts:
  deployment/octavia/octavia-api-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ib3476e53f89b50bae72b9c95a5d3dec51ed3de7e
Related-Bug: #1863595
(cherry picked from commit 6c11a949fc0b940ebc3815aeb86156bd60df5851)

commit_message:
Enable keystone_authtoken/memcach_use_advanced_pool for Sahara

Sahara was removed during Wallaby cycle and because of that it was not
updated when commit 09bcacd25a7217ce66eec10ccfda4847e6d3d87a was
backported from Wallaby to Victoria.
This change updates the Sahara templates to have consistent definition
with the other services.

Related-Bug: #1931047
Change-Id: Idb9a209b2651c1ff03c3ccaa14f4976a9f267e99

commit_message:
Fix CoreDNS 1.7.0 and above

Starting from CoreDNS 1.7.0 the upstream option is not valid anymore
and CoreDNS does not start when it is set. It has been effectively a
noop since 1.5.2.

Task: 42765
Story: 2009030
Change-Id: I4e8029a4cd5e89d7173758fa1dc2e718895fdbe7

'}, {'created': '2021-05-08 06:49:19.000000000', 'message': 'Running Cyborg with rootwrap as a daemon

Add rootwrap when exec command line to get accelerator info, such as
`lspci` to get PCI devices and `lvdisplay` to get disk info, these
command lines have no promissions with no root user.

Change-Id: I21ef97d8e6b5b8ccfb9442cbd27c2b30be785c34
'}]
commit_message:
Running Cyborg with rootwrap as a daemon

Add rootwrap when exec command line to get accelerator info, such as
`lspci` to get PCI devices and `lvdisplay` to get disk info, these
command lines have no promissions with no root user.

Change-Id: I21ef97d8e6b5b8ccfb9442cbd27c2b30be785c34

Change-Id: Ia84885b36bb5a2ca81e0faec5e86a873bc5f6600
'}, {'created': '2021-06-15 02:31:00.000000000', 'message': 'Error message from wsgi is not right

Trove version:
rocky

Step to reappear:
[CMD]# curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $X_SUBJECT_TOKEN" -X POST ${OS_TROVE_ENDPOINT_VERSIONS_URL}/v1.0/${QUERY_TENANT_ID}/instances -d "{}"
When the request body is "{}",use curl to request the Trove-Instance-Create API.

Before Bug-fix:
The error type is not accurate:
{
    "instanceFault": {
        "code": 500,
        "message": "Internal Server Error. Please keep this ID to help us figure out what went wrong: (a71dcbff-07e6-46dc-8453-b8657c498b72)."
    }
}

After Bug-fix:
The error type is right:
{
    "badRequest": {
        "code": 400,
        "message": "Validation error: <root (zero path length)> 'instance' is a required property"
    }
}

task: 42549
story: openstack-trove-bugfix-wocloud
Change-Id: Ia84885b36bb5a2ca81e0faec5e86a873bc5f6600

rocky

Step to reappear:
[CMD]# curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: $X_SUBJECT_TOKEN" -X POST ${OS_TROVE_ENDPOINT_VERSIONS_URL}/v1.0/${QUERY_TENANT_ID}/instances -d "{}"
When the request body is "{}",use curl to request the Trove-Instance-Create API.

Before Bug-fix:
The error type is not accurate:
{
    "instanceFault": {
        "code": 500,
        "message": "Internal Server Error. Please keep this ID to help us figure out what went wrong: (a71dcbff-07e6-46dc-8453-b8657c498b72)."
    }
}

After Bug-fix:
The error type is right:
{
    "badRequest": {
        "code": 400,
        "message": "Validation error: <root (zero path length)> 'instance' is a required property"
    }
}

commit_message:
Error message from wsgi is not right

Trove version:
rocky

When the request body is "{}",use curl to request the Trove-Instance-Create API.
Function trove.common.wsgi.format_validation_msg will go wrong because list 'path' is null so that path[0] is out of range.
AS a result wsgi return a HTTP code 500(Internal Server Error) but actually wsgi should return HTTP code 400(badRequest)

task: 42549
story: 2008934
Change-Id: Ia84885b36bb5a2ca81e0faec5e86a873bc5f6600

commit_message:
sharder: add more validation checks on config

Add checks that more of the sharder config values make sense with
respect to each other.

For the daemon, all config options are checked. For
swift-manage-shard-ranges only those options relevant to the current
subcommand are checked.

Change-Id: I2d4dab1d56c31f904161e5338f1bb89a03fd88f7

We currently don't fully support SELinux so we need to disable it for now until
we get it fixed properly. Make this a variable so that we can change dynamically
later if we need to for testing purposes.

Temporarily disable voting until we get things working properly again. Update

"}]
commit_message:
Disable SELinux for integration testing on RHEL only

We currently don't fully support SELinux so we need to disable it for now until
we get it fixed properly. Make this a variable so that we can change dynamically
later if we need to for testing purposes.

Temporarily disable voting until we get things working properly again. Update
git URI for bind cookbook to use upstream master.

Change-Id: Ib6dec3f6ea1cbc13d9c82d372b4f65f689adc0bc
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-12 20:23:43.000000000', 'message': 'Use publish-to-pypi-stable-only template for deprecated repo

Deprecated deliverables only do the release on stable branches
not on master. But existing publish-to-pypi template does not
have the branch matcher to exclude the master gate from running
the release jobs.

For deprecated repo, we can use new template publish-to-pypi-stable-only
which exclude the master branch to run the release jobs. This will help
us to update the master conent which is README.rst
for example: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-fwaas/+/800140

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/800554
Change-Id: Id6541db65e8b7957941c72d6d29474e07604adf0
'}, {'created': '2021-07-13 23:51:07.000000000', 'message': "Use publish-to-pypi-stable-only template for deprecated repo

Deprecated deliverables only do the release on stable branches
not on master. But existing publish-to-pypi template does not
have the branch matcher to exclude the master gate from running
the release jobs.

For deprecated repo, we can use new template publish-to-pypi-stable-only
which exclude the master branch to run the release jobs. This will help
us to update the master conent which is README.rst
for example: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-fwaas/+/800140

This also update the deprecdated repo description to add 'DEPRECATED'.

And adding noop job for master branch so that we can merge the README.rst
update for OFTC ref.

commit_message:
Use publish-to-pypi-stable-only template for deprecated repo

Deprecated deliverables only do the release on stable branches
not on master. But existing publish-to-pypi template does not
have the branch matcher to exclude the master gate from running
the release jobs.

For deprecated repo, we can use new template publish-to-pypi-stable-only
which exclude the master branch to run the release jobs. This will help
us to update the master conent which is README.rst
for example: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-fwaas/+/800140

This also update the deprecdated repo description to add 'DEPRECATED'.

And adding noop job for master branch so that we can merge the README.rst
update for OFTC ref.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/800554
Change-Id: Id6541db65e8b7957941c72d6d29474e07604adf0

commit_message:
Add concurrency to reconciler

Each reconciler process can now reconcile more than one queue entry at a
time, up to the configured concurrency.

By default concurrency is 1.  There is no expected change to existing
behavior.  Entries are processed serially one a time.

Change-Id: I72e9601b58c2f20bb1294876bb39f2c78827d5f8
